  4461                                  
  4462                                  ;align 2
  4463                                  ;BPB144:
  4464                                  ;bpb144:	; Retro DOS v4.0 feature only !	; 1.44MB diskettes
  4465                                  ;
  4466                                  ;		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4467                                  ;		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4468                                  ;		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4469                                  ;		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4470                                  ;		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4471                                  ;		dw	2880 ; 2*18*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4472                                  ;		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4473                                  ;		dw	9		; number of fat sectors
  4474                                  ;		dw	18		; sectors per track
  4475                                  ;		dw	2		; heads
  4476                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4477                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4478                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4479                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4480                                  ;
  4481                                  ;		db 90h
  4482                                  ;align 2
  4483                                  
  4484                                  BPB288:
  4485                                  ;bpb288:	; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 240, 5760, 0F0h, 9, 36, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0>
  4486                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 2.88 MB ;	 
  4487                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4488                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4489                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4490                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4491                                  		dw	240		; number of directory entries
  4492                                  		dw	5760 ; 2*36*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4493                                  		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4494                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors
  4495                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4496                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4497                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4498                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4499                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4500                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4501                                  
  4502                                  		db 90h			;
  4503                                  ;align 2
  4504                                  
  4505                                  %endif
  4506                                  
  4507                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4508                                  					; align	2
  4509                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4510                                  %if 0
  4511                                  bpbtable:	dw bpb48t		; 48tpi	drives
  4512                                  		dw bpb96t		; 96tpi	drives
  4513                                  		dw bpb35		; 3.5" drives
  4514                                  		dw bpb35		; unused 8" diskette
  4515                                  		dw bpb35		; unused 8" diskette
  4516                                  		dw bpb35		; used for hard	disk
  4517                                  		dw bpb35		; used for tape	drive
  4518                                  		dw bpb35		; FFOTHER
  4519                                  		dw bpb35		; ERIMO
  4520                                  		dw bpb288		; 2.88MB drive
  4521                                  		;
  4522                                  		;dw bpb144		; 1.44MB drive - Retro DOS v4.0 feature !
  4523                                  %endif
  4524                                  
  4525                                  ; 13/12/2022
  4526                                  %if 0
  4527                                  BPBTABLE:	dw BPB48T		; 48tpi	drives
  4528                                  		dw BPB96T		; 96tpi	drives
  4529                                  		dw BPB35		; 3.5" drives
  4530                                  		dw BPB35		; unused 8" diskette
  4531                                  		dw BPB35		; unused 8" diskette
  4532                                  		dw BPB35		; used for hard	disk
  4533                                  		dw BPB35		; used for tape	drive
  4534                                  		dw BPB35		; FFOTHER
  4535                                  		dw BPB35		; ERIMO
  4536                                  		dw BPB288		; 2.88MB drive
  4537                                  		;
  4538                                  		;dw BPB144		; 1.44MB drive - Retro DOS v4.0 feature !
  4539                                  
  4540                                  %endif
  4541                                  
  4542                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4543                                  
  4544                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4545                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4546                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4547                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4548                                  ;
  4549                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4550                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4551                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4552                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4553                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4554                                  ;	  and a retf
  4555                                  
  4556                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4557                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4558                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4559                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4560                                  
  4561                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4562                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4563 0000161F [CC00]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4564                                  
  4565                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4566                                  
  4567                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4568 00001621 2EFF36[1F16]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4569                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4570 00001626 2EFF36[BF06]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4571 0000162B 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4572 0000162C CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4573                                  
  4574                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4575                                  
  4576 0000162D 00                      flp_drvs	db 0			
  4577                                  
  4578                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4579                                  
  4580                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4581                                  
  4582                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4583                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4584                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4585                                  
  4586                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4587                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4588                                  		;=============================================================
  4589                                  		;
  4590                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4591                                  		;
  4592                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4593                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4594                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4595                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4596                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4597                                  
  4598                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4599                                  		;=============================================================
  4600                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4601                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4602                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4603                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4604                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4605                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4606                                  		
  4607 0000162E FA                      		cli
  4608                                  
  4609                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4610                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4611                                  		;push	ax
  4612                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4613                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4614                                  		;pop	ax
  4615                                  	
  4616                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4617                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4618                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4619                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4620                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4621                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4622                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4623                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4624                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4625                                  
  4626                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4627                                  
  4628                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4629                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4630                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4631                                  
  4632 0000162F 2EA3[8A15]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4633 00001633 2E891E[8815]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4634                                  
  4635                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4636                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4637                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4638                                  
  4639 00001638 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4640 00001639 07                      		pop	es
  4641 0000163A 51                      		push	cx
  4642 0000163B 57                      		push	di
  4643                                  
  4644                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4645                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4646                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4647                                  		; ds = cs
  4648 0000163C 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4649 0000163E 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4650                                  		; ds = 0
  4651                                  
  4652 00001640 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4653                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4654                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4655                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4656 00001642 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4657                                  next_int_:		
  4658 00001645 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4659 00001646 AC                      		lodsb		
  4660                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4661 00001647 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4662 00001648 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4663 0000164A D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4664 0000164C 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4665 0000164E 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4666                                  					; saving address in di
  4667 00001650 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4668 00001651 AB                      		stosw
  4669 00001652 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4670 00001653 AB                      		stosw			; save the vector
  4671 00001654 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4672 00001656 E2ED                    		loop	next_int_
  4673 00001658 5F                      		pop	di
  4674 00001659 59                      		pop	cx
  4675                                  
  4676                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4677                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4678                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4679                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4680                                  
  4681                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4682                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4683                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4684                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4685                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4686                                  
  4687                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4688 0000165A C7064C00[4F07]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4689                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4690                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4691 00001660 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4692                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4693 00001664 C7065400[FE07]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4694                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4695                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4696 0000166A 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4697                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4698 0000166E C7066400[BE07]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4699                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4700                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4701 00001674 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4702                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4703                                  
  4704                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4705 00001678 0E                      		push	cs
  4706 00001679 1F                      		pop	ds
  4707                                  		
  4708 0000167A A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4709 0000167D A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4710 00001680 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4711 00001683 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4712                                  					; ;
  4713 00001686 FB                      		sti
  4714 00001687 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4715                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4716                                  
  4717                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4718                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4719                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4720                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4721                                  ;
  4722                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4723                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4724                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4725                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4726                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4727                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4728                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4729                                  
  4730                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4731                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4732                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4733                                  ;
  4734                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4735                                  ; to do anything special.
  4736                                  ;
  4737                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4738                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4739                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4740                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4741                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4742                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4743                                  
  4744                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4745 00001689 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4746                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4747 0000168B 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4748                                  
  4749                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4750                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4751                                  ;
  4752                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4753                                  ;
  4754                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4755                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4756                                  
  4757 0000168D 50                      		push	ax
  4758 0000168E 53                      		push	bx
  4759 0000168F 51                      		push	cx
  4760 00001690 52                      		push	dx
  4761 00001691 57                      		push	di
  4762 00001692 06                      		push	es
  4763 00001693 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4764 00001695 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4765 00001697 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4766                                  					; DL = drive number
  4767                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4768                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4769                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4770 00001699 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4771                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4772                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4773                                  		; ds = cs
  4774 0000169B 8816[2D16]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4775                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4776 0000169F 07                      		pop	es
  4777 000016A0 5F                      		pop	di
  4778 000016A1 5A                      		pop	dx
  4779 000016A2 59                      		pop	cx
  4780 000016A3 5B                      		pop	bx
  4781 000016A4 58                      		pop	ax
  4782 000016A5 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4783                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4784                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4785                                  
  4786                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4787                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4788                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4789                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4790 000016A7 A0[2D16]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4791 000016AA 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4792 000016AC 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4793                                  
  4794                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4795                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4796 000016AE 48                      		dec	ax
  4797 000016AF EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4798                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4799                                  
  4800                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4801                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4802 000016B1 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4803 000016B4 A2[9D15]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4804                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4805                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4806                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4807 000016B7 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4808                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4809                                  
  4810                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4811 000016B9 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4812 000016BB D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4813                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4814                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4815                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4816 000016BD 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4817 000016BF 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4818 000016C1 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4819                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4820                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4821                                  		; ds = cs
  4822 000016C2 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4823                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4824                                  notsingle:				
  4825 000016C6 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4826                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4827                                  					; booted off hard file
  4828 000016C7 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4829                                  
  4830                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4831                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4832                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4833                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4834                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4835                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4836                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4837                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4838                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4839                                  
  4840                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4841                                  
  4842 000016C9 F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4843 000016CC 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4844 000016CE 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4845                                  gothrd:					
  4846 000016D0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4847                                  					; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4848                                  					; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4849                                  					; ch = media byte
  4850 000016D2 FA                      		cli
  4851 000016D3 8ED2                    		mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4852 000016D5 BC0007                  		mov	sp, 700h
  4853 000016D8 FB                      		sti
  4854 000016D9 51                      		push	cx ; *		; save number of floppies and media byte
  4855 000016DA 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4856 000016DC 50                      		push	ax ; **		; save boot drive number and media byte
  4857                                  		
  4858                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4859                                  
  4860 000016DD B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4861 000016DF CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4862 000016E1 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4863 000016E3 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4864 000016E6 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4865                                  
  4866                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4867                                  		; ds = cs
  4868 000016E8 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_modelbyte]
  4869 000016EC A2[3606]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4870                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  4871                                  					; get/save model byte
  4872 000016EF 268A4703                		mov	al, [es:bx+3]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte]
  4873 000016F3 A2[3706]                		mov	[secondary_model_byte], al
  4874                                  		;mov	[cs:secondary_model_byte], al
  4875                                  					; get/save secondary model byte
  4876 000016F6 EB0C                    		jmp	short turn_timer_on
  4877                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4878                                  
  4879                                  no_rom_system_conf:			
  4880 000016F8 BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh
  4881 000016FB 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
  4882                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4883 000016FD 26A00E00                		mov	al, [es:0Eh]	; get model byte (from 0FFFFh:0Eh)
  4884 00001701 A2[3606]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4885                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al ; save model byte
  4886                                  turn_timer_on:				
  4887 00001704 B020                    		mov	al, 20h	; ' '   ; turn on the timer
  4888 00001706 E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.

  5193                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5194                                  ; diskette drives:

  5197                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5198                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.

  5201                                  ;

  5216                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives

  5218                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5219                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5220                                  
  5221                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5222                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5223                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5224                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5225                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5226                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5227                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5228                                  ; the bds for harddrives.

  5264                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  5266 00001883 7276                    		jc	short noparmsfromrom

  5268                                  ; if cmos is bad, it gives es,ax,bx,cx,dh,di=0. cy=0.
  5269                                  ; in this case, we are going to put bogus informations to bds table.
  5270                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when
  5271                                  ; they are calculated at the later time. this is just for the diagnostic
  5272                                  ; diskette which need msbio,msdos to boot up before it sets cmos.
  5273                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.
  5274

  5278                                  		;mov	cl, 9		; let's default to 360k.
  5279                                  		; 21/12/2022

  5284 00001891 FEC5                    		inc	ch		; make number of cylinders 1-based

  5528                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5529                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5530                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5531                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5545                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5546                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5547                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5548                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5549                                  ;
  5550                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5551                                  ;
  5552                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5553                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5554                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5555                                  ;use to start with.
  5556                                  ;
  5557                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5558                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5559                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5560                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5561                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5562

  5630                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5631                                  
  5632                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5633                                  ;
  5634                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5635                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5636                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5637                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5638                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5639                                  ; off of it.
  5640                                  ;
  5641                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5642                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5643                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5644                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5645                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5646                                  
  5647                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5648                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5649                                  checkcompaqbug:
  5650                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5651                                  		; es = 0F000h
  5652                                  		;mov	ax, 0F000h	; point	to ROM BIOS
  5653                                  		;mov	es, ax
  5654                                  
  5655                                  		; 19/10/2022
  5656 00001A1B 26813EEAFF434F          		cmp	word [es:0FFEAh], 'CO'
  5657                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEAh, 'OC' ; look for COMPAQ
  5658 00001A22 754B                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5659 00001A24 26813EECFF4D50          		cmp	word [es:0FFECh], 'MP'
  5660                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFECh, 'PM'
  5661 00001A2B 7542                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5662 00001A2D 26813EEEFF4151          		cmp	word [es:0FFEEh], 'AQ'
  5663                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEEh, 'QA'
  5664 00001A34 7539                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5665                                  
  5666                                  ; We're running on a COMPAQ. Now look at the date code.
  5667                                  
  5668 00001A36 26A1FBFF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFFBh]	; get year
  5669 00001A3A 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5670 00001A3C 3D3638                  		cmp	ax, 3836h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5671                                  		;cmp	ax, '86'        ; 3836h
  5672                                  					; is it	86?
  5673 00001A3F 772E                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch
  5674 00001A41 7218                    		jb	short do_compaq_patch
  5675 00001A43 26A1F5FF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFF5h]	; get month
  5676 00001A47 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al

  5678                                  		;cmp	ax, '08'        ; 3038h

  5680 00001A4C 7721                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch
  5681 00001A4E 720B                    		jb	short do_compaq_patch
  5682 00001A50 26A1F8FF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFF8h]	; get day
  5683 00001A54 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al

  5685                                  		;cmp	ax, '04'        ; 3034h

  5687 00001A59 7314                    		jnb	short not_compaq_patch

  5938                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5939                                  ;
  5940                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5941                                  
  5942                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5943                                  
  5944                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5945                                  ; module name: remap
  5946                                  ;
  5947                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5948                                  ;
  5949                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5950                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5951                                  ;
  5952                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5953                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5954                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5955                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5956                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5957                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5958                                  
  5959                                  ; input:       none
  5960                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5961                                  ; exit error:  none
  5962                                  ; called from: msinit
  5963                                  ;
  5964                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5965                                  ;	  found in the system
  5966                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5967                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5968                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5969                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5970                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5971                                  ;
  5972                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5973                                  
  5974                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5975                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5976                                  
  5977                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5978 00001B14 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5979                                  
  5980                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5981                                  
  5982                                  drive_loop:				
  5983 00001B19 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5984                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5985 00001B1D 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5986 00001B1F 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5987                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5988 00001B21 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5989 00001B24 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5990 00001B26 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5991                                  
  5992                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5993                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5994                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5995                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5996                                  
  5997                                  fdrv_found:				
  5998 00001B28 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5999                                  fdrv_loop:				
  6000 00001B2A 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6001                                  					; found	??
  6002 00001B2D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6003                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6004                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6005                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6006 00001B2F 40                      		inc	ax
  6007 00001B30 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  6008 00001B33 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  6009                                  
  6010                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6011                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6012                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6013                                  ; any more.
  6014                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6015                                  
  6016 00001B35 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6017                                  					; get first bds
  6018 00001B3A 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6019                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6020 00001B3C 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6021 00001B41 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6022                                  remap_loop1:				
  6023 00001B44 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6024                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6025 00001B46 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6026 00001B49 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6027 00001B4B FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  6028 00001B4D 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6029                                  
  6030                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6031                                  
  6032 00001B4F 2EA0[8615]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6033 00001B53 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6034 00001B55 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6035 00001B57 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  6036 00001B5C 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6037                                  
  6038                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6039                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6040                                  
  6041 00001B5E 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6042 00001B60 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6043                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6044                                  
  6045                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6046                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6047                                  
  6048                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  6049 00001B62 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6050                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6051 00001B67 2EA2[8615]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6052 00001B6B FEC0                    		inc	al
  6053 00001B6D 1E                      		push	ds
  6054 00001B6E BF4804                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6055                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6056 00001B71 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6057 00001B73 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6058                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6059                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6060 00001B76 1F                      		pop	ds
  6061                                  rmap_exit:				
  6062 00001B77 C3                      		retn
  6063                                  
  6064                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6065                                  
  6066                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6067                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6068                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6069                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6070                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6071                                  ;**************************************************
  6072                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6073                                  ;
  6074                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6075                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6076                                  ;
  6077                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6078                                  ;**************************************************
  6079                                  
  6080                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6081                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6082                                  
  6083                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  6084                                  		
  6085                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6086                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6087                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6088                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6089                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6090                                  
  6091 00001B78 2EA1[9115]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6092 00001B7C 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6093                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6094 00001B7E BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6095                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6096                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6097 00001B81 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6098 00001B84 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6099 00001B86 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6100 00001B89 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6101                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6102                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6103                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6104 00001B8B 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6105                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6106 00001B8D 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6107                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6108                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6109 00001B94 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6110                                  erret:					
  6111 00001B96 F9                      		stc
  6112                                  norm_ret:				
  6113 00001B97 C3                      		retn
  6114                                  
  6115                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6116                                  
  6117                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6118                                  
  6119                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6120                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6121                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6122                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6123                                  ;   determine version number
  6124                                  ;
  6125                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6126                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6127                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6128                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6129                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6130                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6131                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6132                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6133                                  
  6134                                  sethard:	; proc near
  6135                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6136                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6137 00001B98 57                      		push	di
  6138 00001B99 53                      		push	bx
  6139                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  6140 00001B9A 06                      		push	es
  6141 00001B9B 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6142 00001B9E 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6143 00001BA1 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6144                                  					; fnon_removable
  6145 00001BA5 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6146                                  					; ffHardFile
  6147 00001BA9 C606[8E15]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6148 00001BAE 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6149 00001BB0 52                      		push	dx
  6150 00001BB1 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6151 00001BB3 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6152                                  					; DL = drive number
  6153                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6154                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6155                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6156 00001BB5 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6157 00001BB7 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6158 00001BBA 5A                      		pop	dx
  6159 00001BBB 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6160 00001BBD 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6161 00001BC0 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6162 00001BC3 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6163 00001BC4 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  6164 00001BC7 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6165 00001BC8 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6166 00001BCA BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6167                                  
  6168                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6169                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6170                                  
  6171                                  act_part:
  6172 00001BCD 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6173 00001BD2 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6174 00001BD4 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6175 00001BD8 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6176 00001BDA 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6177 00001BDE 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6178 00001BE0 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6179 00001BE4 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6180                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  6181 00001BE6 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6182                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  6183 00001BE8 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6184 00001BEA FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6185                                  no_act:					
  6186 00001BEC 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6187 00001BEF 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6188                                  					; last entry done?
  6189 00001BF3 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6190 00001BF5 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6191                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6192                                  
  6193                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6194                                  
  6195                                  get_primary:
  6196 00001BF8 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6197 00001BFD 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6198                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6199 00001BFF 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6200 00001C03 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6201 00001C05 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6202 00001C09 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6203 00001C0B 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6204 00001C0F 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6205                                  got_prim:
  6206 00001C11 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6207 00001C13 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6208 00001C15 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6209                                  not_prim:
  6210 00001C17 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6211 00001C1A 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6212 00001C1E 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6213                                  setret:					
  6214 00001C20 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6215 00001C21 E99602                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6216                                  
  6217                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6218                                  
  6219                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6220                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6221                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6222                                  ;
  6223                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6224                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6225                                  ;  without change.
  6226                                  ;
  6227                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6228                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6229                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6230                                  
  6231                                  set2:		
  6232                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6233                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6234 00001C24 8816[9315]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6235                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6236                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6237 00001C28 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6238 00001C2C 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6239                                  
  6240                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6241                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6242                                  
  6243 00001C30 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6244 00001C33 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6245 00001C36 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6246 00001C3A 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6247 00001C3E 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6248 00001C40 800E[8E15]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6249                                  okdrive:
  6250 00001C45 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6251 00001C49 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6252                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6253 00001C4C 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6254 00001C50 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6255 00001C53 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6256 00001C57 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6257 00001C5B 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6258 00001C5E 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6259                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6260 00001C61 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6261 00001C64 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6262 00001C66 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6263 00001C69 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6264                                  okdrive_1:
  6265 00001C6B 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6266 00001C6E 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6267 00001C71 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6268                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6269 00001C73 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6270 00001C76 50                      		push	ax
  6271 00001C77 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6272 00001C79 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6273 00001C7B F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6274                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6275                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6276                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6277                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6278 00001C7D A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  6279 00001C80 58                      		pop	ax
  6280 00001C81 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6281 00001C83 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6282 00001C85 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6283 00001C87 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6284 00001C89 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6285 00001C8C 50                      		push	ax
  6286 00001C8D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6287                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6288 00001C8F A1[2105]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 12/08/2023
  6289 00001C92 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6290                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6291 00001C94 A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 12/08/2023
  6292 00001C97 58                      		pop	ax
  6293 00001C98 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6294                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6295 00001C9A 833E[2105]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  6296                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6297 00001C9F 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6298 00001CA1 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6299 00001CA4 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6300                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6301                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6302                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6303                                  okdrive_2:
  6304                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6305                                  ; dl is head.
  6306                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6307                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6308                                  
  6309                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6310                                  
  6311 00001CA6 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6312                                  					; check for mini disk
  6313 00001CAA 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6314 00001CAC 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6315                                  					; set the physical track number
  6316                                  oknotmini:
  6317                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6318                                  				
  6319 00001CAF D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  6320 00001CB1 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6321 00001CB3 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  6322 00001CB6 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  6323 00001CB8 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch iscylinder (low 8 bits)
  6324                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6325 00001CBA 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6326                                  		
  6327                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6328 00001CBC 8A16[9315]              		mov	dl, [rom_drv_num]
  6329                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6330                                  
  6331                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6332                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6333                                  ; dh is head
  6334                                  ; dl is drive
  6335                                  
  6336                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6337                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6338                                  
  6339                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6340                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6341                                  
  6342 00001CC0 0E                      		push	cs
  6343 00001CC1 07                      		pop	es
  6344 00001CC2 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6345                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6346                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6347 00001CC5 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6348 00001CC8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6349                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6350                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6351                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6352                                  
  6353                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6354                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6355                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6356                                  
  6357                                  		; 11/08/2023
  6358                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  6359                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6360 00001CCA 53                      		push	bx
  6361 00001CCB 50                      		push	ax
  6362                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6363                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  6364 00001CCC 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  6365                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6366 00001CCF 740B                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6367 00001CD1 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  6368                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6369 00001CD4 7525                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6370 00001CD6 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  6371                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6372 00001CDA 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  6373                                  check_1_ok:
  6374                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6375 00001CDC BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6376                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6377                                  					; point to the bpb in the boot record
  6378                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6379 00001CDF 8A470A                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 12/08/2023 
  6380                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6381 00001CE2 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6382 00001CE4 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6383 00001CE6 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  6384                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6385 00001CE8 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 12/08/2023
  6386 00001CEC 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6387                                  
  6388                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6389 00001CEE 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 12/08/2023
  6390                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  6391                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  6392                                  					; a power of 2
  6393                                  					;
  6394                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6395                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6396 00001CF1 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it zero?
  6397 00001CF3 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6398                                  
  6399                                  ck_power_of_two:
  6400 00001CF5 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift until first bit emerges
  6401 00001CF7 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6402 00001CF9 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6403                                  
  6404                                  invalid_boot_record:
  6405 00001CFB 58                      		pop	ax
  6406 00001CFC 5B                      		pop	bx
  6407 00001CFD E90901                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6408                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6409                                  
  6410                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6411                                  	; 12/08/2023
  6412                                  setret_brdg:
  6413 00001D00 E91DFF                  		jmp	setret
  6414                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6415                                  
  6416                                  unknown3_0_j:
  6417 00001D03 E90701                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6418                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  6419                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6420                                  
  6421                                  valid_boot_record:
  6422 00001D06 58                      		pop	ax
  6423 00001D07 5B                      		pop	bx
  6424                                  
  6425                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  6426                                  
  6427                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6428 00001D08 817F08322E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '2.'
  6429                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6430                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E32h ; '2.'
  6431 00001D0D 7506                    		jnz	short try5
  6432 00001D0F 807F0A30                		cmp	byte [bx+10], '0'
  6433                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+0Ah], '0' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6434                                  		;;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 30h ; '0'
  6435                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6436                                  		;jnz	short try5
  6437                                  		;jmp	short copybpb
  6438 00001D13 7425                    		jz	short copybpb
  6439                                  
  6440                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6441                                  ;	; 12/08/2023
  6442                                  ;setret_brdg:
  6443                                  ;		jmp	setret
  6444                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6445                                  ;
  6446                                  ;unknown3_0_j:
  6447                                  ;		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6448                                  ;					; although, content might be bad.
  6449                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6450                                  
  6451                                  try5:
  6452 00001D15 E8A601                  		call	cover_fdisk_bug
  6453                                  
  6454                                  ; see if it is an os2 signature
  6455                                  
  6456                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6457                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment
  6458 00001D18 817F08302E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '0.'
  6459                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '0.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6460                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E30h ; '0.'
  6461 00001D1D 750C                    		jnz	short no_os2
  6462 00001D1F 8A4707                  		mov	al, [bx+7] ; 12/08/2023
  6463                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+7]	; 17/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6464 00001D22 2C31                    		sub	al, '1'
  6465                                  		;sub	al, 31h		; '1'
  6466 00001D24 24FE                    		and	al, 0FEh
  6467 00001D26 7412                    		jz	short copybpb	; accept either	'1' or '2'
  6468 00001D28 E9DE00                  		jmp	unknown
  6469                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6470                                  
  6471                                  ; no os2 signature, this is to check for real dos versions
  6472                                  
  6473                                  no_os2:
  6474                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6475                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6476 00001D2B 817F08332E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '3.'			
  6477                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '3.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6478                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E33h ; '3.'
  6479 00001D30 72D1                    		jb	short unknown3_0_j ; must be 2.1 boot record.
  6480                                  					; do not trust it, but still legal.
  6481 00001D32 7506                    		jnz	short copybpb	; honor	os2 boot record

  6868                                  					; if (fbigfat)
  6869 00001E49 751E                    		jnz	short dobig	; goto dobig; (16 bit fat)
  6870                                  
  6871                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is guaranteed
  6872                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6873                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6874                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  6875                                  
  6876 00001E4B 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; 12 bit fat (FAT12 fs)
  6877 00001E4D 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch
  6878 00001E4F 4B                      		dec	bx
  6879 00001E50 01C3                    		add	bx, ax		; dx=0

  6881 00001E54 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus
  6882 00001E55 80E3FE                  		and	bl, 0FEh	; bx &= ~1; (=number of clusters)
  6883 00001E58 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
  6884 00001E5A D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1
  6885 00001E5C 01F3                    		add	bx, si		; number of FAT bytes ; 08/08/2023
  6886 00001E5E 81C3FF01                		add	bx, 511		; bx +=	511 + bx/2
  6887 00001E62 D0EF                    		shr	bh, 1		; bh >>= 1; (=bx/512)
  6888 00001E64 887D11                  		mov	[di+11h], bh	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6889                                  					; save number of fat sectors
  6890 00001E67 EB32                    		jmp	short massage_bpb
