 13634                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13635                                  
 13636                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13637                                  
 13638                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13639                                  ;
 13640                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13641                                  ;
 13642                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13643                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13644                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13645                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13646                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13647                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13648                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13649                                  ;
 13650                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13651                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13652                                  ;
 13653                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13654                                  
 13655                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13656                                  HMAPtr:
 13657 00001462 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13658                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13659 00001467 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13660                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13661 0000146B 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13662 0000146E 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13663 00001470 803E[9C08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13664                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13665 00001475 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13666 00001477 FF1E[9808]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13667                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13668 0000147B 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13669                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13670                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13671 0000147F C3                      		retn
 13672                                  
 13673                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13674                                  
 13675                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13676                                  
 13677                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13678                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13679                                  
 13680                                  move_sector:
 13681                                  
 13682                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13683                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13684                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13685                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13686                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13687                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13688                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13689                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13690                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13691                                  ;
 13692                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13693                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13694                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13695                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13696                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13697                                  
 13698 00001480 FC                      		cld
 13699 00001481 51                      		push	cx
 13700 00001482 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13701 00001485 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13702 00001489 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13703 0000148B 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13704 0000148F 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13705 00001491 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13706 00001493 59                      		pop	cx
 13707 00001494 C3                      		retn
 13708                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13709                                  
 13710                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13711 00001495 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13712 00001497 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13713 00001499 59                      		pop	cx
 13714 0000149A C3                      		retn
 13715                                  
 13716                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13717                                  
 13718                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13719                                  
 13720                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13721                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13722                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13723                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13724                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13725                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13726                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13727                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13728                                  ;
 13729                                  ; input conditions:
 13730                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13731                                  ;
 13732                                  ; output:
 13733                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13734                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13735                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13736                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13737                                  
 13738                                  check_wrap:	
 13739 0000149B 50                      		push	ax
 13740 0000149C 53                      		push	bx
 13741 0000149D 06                      		push	es
 13742 0000149E 57                      		push	di
 13743 0000149F E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13744 000014A2 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13745                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13746 000014A4 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13747                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13748 000014A9 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13749 000014AB 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13750 000014AF 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13751 000014B1 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13752 000014B4 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13753 000014B6 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13754 000014B8 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13755                                  
 13756                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13757                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13758                                  
 13759 000014BA 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13760 000014BC 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13761                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13762 000014BE 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13763 000014BF 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13764                                  					; if on	boundary
 13765                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13766                                  not_on_bound:				
 13767 000014C1 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13768 000014C4 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13769 000014C6 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13770 000014C8 40                      		inc	ax
 13771 000014C9 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13772 000014CB 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13773 000014CE 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13774                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13775 000014D2 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13776 000014D4 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13777 000014D5 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13778 000014D7 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13779 000014DB F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13780                                  
 13781                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13782                                  
 13783 000014DD 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13784 000014DF 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13785 000014E1 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13786                                  
 13787                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13788                                  
 13789 000014E3 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13790 000014E5 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13791 000014E7 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13792                                  no_head_bound:				
 13793 000014E8 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13794 000014EA 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13795 000014EB FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13796 000014ED 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13797 000014EF 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13798 000014F1 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13799 000014F4 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13800 000014F6 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13801 000014F8 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13802 000014FA 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13803 000014FC 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13804 000014FE D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13805 00001500 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13806 00001502 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13807                                  no_wrap:				
 13808 00001504 F8                      		clc
 13809 00001505 5F                      		pop	di
 13810 00001506 07                      		pop	es
 13811 00001507 5B                      		pop	bx
 13812 00001508 58                      		pop	ax
 13813 00001509 C3                      		retn
 13814                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13815                                  
 13816                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13817 0000150A 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13818 0000150C FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13819 0000150E EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13820                                  
 13821                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13822                                  
 13823                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13824                                  
 13825                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13826                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13827                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13828                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13829                                  ;
 13830                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13831                                  
 13832                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13833                                  find_bds:	
 13834 00001510 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13835                                  fbds_1:					
 13836 00001514 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13837 00001518 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13838 0000151A 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13839                                  					; go to next bds
 13840 0000151D 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13841 00001520 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13842 00001522 F9                      		stc
 13843                                  fdbs_2:					
 13844 00001523 C3                      		retn
 13845                                  
 13846                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13847                                  
 13848                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13849                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13850                                  doint:
 13851                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13852 00001524 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13853                                  					; get physical drive number
 13854                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13855                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13856                                  		
 13857 00001527 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13858 00001529 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13859 0000152B 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13860                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13861 0000152D 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13862                                  					; get request code
 13863                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13864 00001530 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13865                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13866 00001533 9D                      		popf
 13867                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13868                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13869 00001534 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13870                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13871                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13872 00001539 9C                      		pushf
 13873                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13874 0000153A 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13875                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13876                                  dointdone:				
 13877 0000153D C3                      		retn
 13878                                  
 13879                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13880                                  
 13881                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13882                                  
 13883                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13884                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13885                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13886                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13887                                  ;
 13888                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13889                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13890                                  ;
 13891                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13892                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13893                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13894                                  
 13895                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13896                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13897                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13898                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13899                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13900                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13901                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13902                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13903                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13904                                  ;end struc
 13905                                  
 13906                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13907                                  
 13908                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13909                                  ;	ah = function
 13910                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13911                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13912                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13913                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13914                                  ;   output conditions:
 13915                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13916                                  
 13917                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13918                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13919                                  ;
 13920                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13921                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13922                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13923                                  
 13924                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13925                                  
 13926                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13927                                  
 13928 0000153E 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13929                                  
 13930                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13931                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13932                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13933                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13934                                  
 13935                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13936                                  
 13937                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13938                                  
 13939                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13940                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13941                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13942                                  
 13943                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13944 00001542 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13945 00001547 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13946 00001549 53                      		push	bx
 13947 0000154A BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13948 0000154D E84504                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13949 00001550 5B                      		pop	bx
 13950 00001551 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13951                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13952                                  
 13953                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13954                                  
 13955                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13956                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13957                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13958                                  
 13959                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13960                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13961 00001553 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13962 00001555 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13963 00001557 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13964 00001558 51                      		push	cx
 13965 00001559 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13966 0000155B B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13967 0000155D D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13968 0000155F 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13969 00001563 59                      		pop	cx
 13970 00001564 58                      		pop	ax
 13971 00001565 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13972                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13973 00001567 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13974 00001568 06                      		push	es
 13975                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13976 00001569 2EC41E[3E15]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13977                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13978                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13979 0000156E 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13980 00001570 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13981 00001573 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13982                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13983                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13984 00001577 07                      		pop	es
 13985 00001578 5B                      		pop	bx
 13986 00001579 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13987                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13988                                  
 13989                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13990                                  
 13991                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13992                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13993                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13994                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13995                                  
 13996                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13997 0000157B 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13998                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13999 00001580 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14000 00001582 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14001                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14002 00001587 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14003                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 14004 00001589 50                      		push	ax
 14005 0000158A B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14006                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14007                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14008 0000158C 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14009                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14010                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14011 00001591 58                      		pop	ax
 14012 00001592 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14013                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14014                                  
 14015                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14016                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14017                                  
 14018                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14019                                  
 14020                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14021                                  
 14022                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14023                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14024                                  
 14025                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14026 00001594 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14027                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14028                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14029 00001595 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14030                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14031                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14032                                  
 14033                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14034                                  
 14035 0000159A A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14036 0000159D 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14037 000015A0 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14038                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14039                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 14040 000015A2 803E[2905]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14041 000015A7 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14042                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14043                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14044                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 14045 000015A9 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14046                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14047                                  		
 14048 000015AE 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14049                                  		
 14050 000015AF 803E[3606]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14051                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14052 000015B4 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14053                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14054                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 14055 000015B6 9D                      		popf
 14056 000015B7 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14057                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14058 000015B9 1F                      		pop	ds
 14059 000015BA CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14060                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14061                                  
 14062                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14063                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14064                                  ; a changeline error.
 14065                                  
 14066                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14067 000015BD 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14068                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14069 000015BF 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14070 000015C2 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14071 000015C4 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14072 000015C6 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14073 000015C8 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14074 000015CD 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14075                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14076                                  					; never	would
 14077 000015CF 53                      		push	bx
 14078 000015D0 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14079 000015D3 E8BF03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14080 000015D6 5B                      		pop	bx
 14081                                  int13b:					
 14082 000015D7 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14083 000015D8 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14084                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14085                                  
 14086                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14087                                  
 14088                                  goterr13:				
 14089 000015DA 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14090 000015DD 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14091                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14092 000015DF 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14093 000015E2 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14094 000015E4 803E[3006]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14095 000015E9 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14096                                  
 14097 000015EB 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14098                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14099                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14100                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14101 000015F0 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14102                                  
 14103 000015F2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14104                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14105                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14106 000015F4 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14107                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14108                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14109 000015F9 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14110 000015FC 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14111 000015FE 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14112 00001600 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14113 00001602 53                      		push	bx
 14114 00001603 51                      		push	cx
 14115 00001604 52                      		push	dx
 14116 00001605 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14117                                  loop_ecc:				
 14118 00001608 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14119                                  
 14120                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14121                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14122                                  ;
 14123                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14124                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14125                                  ; track.
 14126                                  ;
 14127                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14128                                  ; this request.
 14129                                  ;
 14130                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14131                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14132                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14133                                  ;
 14134 0000160B E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14135                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14136                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14137 0000160E 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14138                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14139 00001613 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14140 00001615 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14141 00001618 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14142 0000161A 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14143 0000161D 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14144                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14145                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14146                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14147 0000161F 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14148                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14149                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14150                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14151                                  ok11_op:				
 14152 00001621 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14153 00001625 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14154 00001627 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14155                                  					; add 200h to address
 14156 00001629 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14157 0000162B FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14158 0000162D EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14159                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14160                                  
 14161                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14162                                  
 14163                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14164 0000162F F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14165                                  ok11_exit:				
 14166 00001630 5A                      		pop	dx
 14167 00001631 59                      		pop	cx
 14168 00001632 5B                      		pop	bx
 14169 00001633 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14170                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14171                                  
 14172                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14173                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14174                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14175                                  
 14176                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14177 00001635 06                      		push	es
 14178 00001636 53                      		push	bx
 14179 00001637 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14180 0000163A 1E                      		push	ds
 14181 0000163B 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14182 0000163C B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14183                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14184                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14185 0000163F 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14186                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14187 00001644 5B                      		pop	bx
 14188 00001645 07                      		pop	es
 14189 00001646 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14190 00001648 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14191 0000164B 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14192                                  
 14193                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14194                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14195                                  
 14196                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14197 0000164D 56                      		push	si
 14198 0000164E 57                      		push	di
 14199 0000164F 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14200 00001651 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14201 00001654 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 14202 00001657 5F                      		pop	di
 14203 00001658 5E                      		pop	si
 14204 00001659 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14205                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14206                                  
 14207                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14208                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14209                                  
 14210                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14211 0000165B A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14212 0000165E FB                      		sti
 14213 0000165F 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14214 00001662 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14215                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14216                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14217 00001664 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14218 00001667 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14219 00001669 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14220 0000166C 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14221 0000166E 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14222                                  
 14223                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14224                                  
 14225                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14226                                  
 14227 00001670 52                      		push	dx
 14228 00001671 51                      		push	cx
 14229 00001672 53                      		push	bx
 14230 00001673 50                      		push	ax
 14231 00001674 55                      		push	bp
 14232 00001675 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14233 00001677 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14234 00001679 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14235 0000167B D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14236 0000167D D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14237 0000167F D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14238 00001681 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14239 00001683 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14240                                  
 14241                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14242                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14243                                  
 14244 00001687 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14245 00001689 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14246                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14247                                  
 14248                                  no_skip_first:				
 14249 0000168C D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14250 0000168E B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14251 00001690 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14252                                  
 14253                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14254                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14255                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14256                                  ;
 14257                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14258                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14259                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14260                                  ; in error.
 14261                                  
 14262 00001692 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14263 00001694 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14264                                  
 14265                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14266                                  
 14267 00001696 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14268                                  					; set up head number
 14269 00001699 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14270 0000169C E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14271                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14272                                  
 14273                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14274 0000169F B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14275 000016A1 F9                      		stc
 14276 000016A2 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14277                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14278                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14279                                  
 14280                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14281                                  
 14282                                  intverify:				
 14283 000016A5 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14284 000016A6 53                      		push	bx
 14285 000016A7 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14286 000016A8 07                      		pop	es
 14287                                  dosimple:				
 14288 000016A9 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14289                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14290                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14291                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14292 000016AC 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14293                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14294 000016B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 14295 000016B2 07                      		pop	es
 14296 000016B3 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14297                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14298                                  
 14299                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14300                                  
 14301                                  intformat:				
 14302 000016B6 06                      		push	es
 14303 000016B7 53                      		push	bx
 14304 000016B8 56                      		push	si
 14305 000016B9 57                      		push	di
 14306 000016BA 1E                      		push	ds
 14307                                  
 14308                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14309                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14310                                  
 14311 000016BB 06                      		push	es
 14312 000016BC 1E                      		push	ds
 14313 000016BD 07                      		pop	es
 14314 000016BE 1F                      		pop	ds
 14315 000016BF 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14316 000016C1 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14317 000016C4 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14318 000016C7 1F                      		pop	ds
 14319 000016C8 5F                      		pop	di
 14320 000016C9 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14321 000016CA EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14322                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14323                                  
 14324                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14325                                  ; the first block.
 14326                                  ;
 14327                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14328                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14329                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14330                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14331                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14332                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14333                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14334                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14335                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14336                                  
 14337                                  doblock:
 14338                                  
 14339                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14340                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14341                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14342                                  				
 14343 000016CC 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14344                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14345 000016CF 51                      		push	cx
 14346 000016D0 06                      		push	es
 14347 000016D1 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14348                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14349 000016D2 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14350 000016D5 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14351                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14352 000016D9 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14353                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14354 000016DE 5F                      		pop	di
 14355 000016DF 07                      		pop	es
 14356 000016E0 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14357 000016E2 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14358 000016E4 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14359 000016E6 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14360                                  doblockflop:				
 14361 000016E8 59                      		pop	cx
 14362                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14363 000016E9 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14364 000016EB 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14365 000016ED 50                      		push	ax
 14366 000016EE 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14367 000016F0 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14368                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14369                                  
 14370                                  doblocklast:				
 14371 000016F2 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14372 000016F4 50                      		push	ax
 14373                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14374 000016F5 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14375 000016F8 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14376 000016FA 58                      		pop	ax
 14377 000016FB 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14378                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14379 000016FE 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14380 00001700 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14381 00001702 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14382 00001704 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14383 00001706 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14384                                  					; then we are done already.
 14385 00001708 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14386                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14387 0000170A E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14388 0000170D EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14389                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14390                                  
 14391                                  bufferx:				
 14392 0000170F 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14393                                  					; set up head number
 14394                                  buffer:					
 14395 00001712 53                      		push	bx
 14396 00001713 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14397 00001716 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14398 00001719 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14399                                  					
 14400                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14401                                  
 14402 0000171B 06                      		push	es
 14403 0000171C 1E                      		push	ds
 14404 0000171D 56                      		push	si
 14405 0000171E 57                      		push	di
 14406 0000171F 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14407 00001720 06                      		push	es
 14408 00001721 1F                      		pop	ds
 14409 00001722 07                      		pop	es
 14410 00001723 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14411 00001726 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14412 00001727 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14413 00001729 E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14414 0000172C 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14415                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14416 0000172D 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14417 0000172E 5E                      		pop	si
 14418 0000172F 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14419                                  
 14420                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14421                                  
 14422 00001730 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14423                                  					; get drive number
 14424 00001732 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14425 00001735 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14426                                  					;
 14427                                  					; ah is	function
 14428                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14429                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14430                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14431                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14432                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14433 00001738 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14434 0000173B 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14435 0000173C 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14436 0000173E EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14437                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14438                                  
 14439                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14440                                  
 14441                                  doread:					
 14442 00001740 06                      		push	es
 14443 00001741 53                      		push	bx
 14444 00001742 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14445 00001743 07                      		pop	es
 14446 00001744 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14447 00001747 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14448 00001749 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14449                                  					; get drive number
 14450 0000174C E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14451                                  					; ah = function
 14452                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14453                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14454                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14455 0000174F E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14456 00001752 5B                      		pop	bx
 14457 00001753 07                      		pop	es
 14458 00001754 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14459 00001756 56                      		push	si
 14460 00001757 57                      		push	di
 14461 00001758 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14462 0000175A BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14463 0000175D E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 14464 00001760 5F                      		pop	di
 14465 00001761 5E                      		pop	si
 14466                                  
 14467                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14468                                  
 14469                                  dotail:					
 14470 00001762 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14471 00001763 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14472 00001766 41                      		inc	cx
 14473 00001767 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14474 0000176A F8                      		clc
 14475 0000176B FEC8                    		dec	al
 14476 0000176D 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14477                                  
 14478                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14479                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14480                                  
 14481 0000176F 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14482 00001772 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14483 00001775 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14484                                  
 14485                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14486                                  
 14487                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14488                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14489                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14490                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14491                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14492                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14493                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14494                                  
 14495                                  bad13:					
 14496 00001778 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14497 0000177A 5D                      		pop	bp
 14498 0000177B 5B                      		pop	bx
 14499 0000177C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14500 0000177D 59                      		pop	cx
 14501 0000177E 5A                      		pop	dx
 14502 0000177F 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14503 00001781 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14504                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14505                                  
 14506                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14507 00001784 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14508                                  
 14509                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14510                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14511                                  		;db 	0
 14512                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14513                                  
 14514                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14515                                  
 14516                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14517                                  
 14518                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14519                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 14520                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14521                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14522                                  
 14523                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14524                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14525 00001787 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14526 0000178B BF[7F06]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14527 0000178E 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14528 0000178F 07                      		pop	es
 14529 00001790 E9C3EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14530                                  
 14531                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14532                                  
 14533                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14534                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14535                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14536                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14537                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14538                                  
 14539                                  install_bds:		
 14540 00001793 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14541 00001794 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14542                                  
 14543                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14544                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14545                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14546 00001797 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14547                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14548 00001799 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14549 0000179D 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14550                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14551 000017A0 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14552 000017A2 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14553 000017A4 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14554                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14555 000017A8 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14556 000017AB 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14557                                  					; we don't own it
 14558 000017B0 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14559                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14560 000017B3 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14561 000017B6 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14562                                  next_bds:				
 14563 000017BA 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14564                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14565 000017BD 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14566 000017BF 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14567                                  					; install bds
 14568 000017C2 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14569 000017C4 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14570                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14571 000017C9 1F                      		pop	ds
 14572                                  
 14573                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 14574                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14575                                  
 14576                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14577                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14578                                  
 14579                                  		; 01/06/2019
 14580 000017CA 268A4534                		mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14581                                  		; 22/07/2023
 14582                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14583 000017CE 3A06[2C01]              		cmp	al,[eot]
 14584 000017D2 7603                    		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14585 000017D4 A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot],al
 14586                                  _eot_ok:
 14587 000017D7 C3                      		retn
 14588

 14595                                  DRVLET equ drvlet

 14599                                  
 14600                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14601                                  ;  ask to swap the disk in drive a:
 14602                                  ;	es:di -> bds
 14603                                  ;	ds -> Bios_Data
 14604                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14605
