 15544                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15545                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15546                                  
 15547                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15548                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15549                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15550                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15551                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15552                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15553                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15554                                  ;
 15555                                  ;
 15556                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15557                                  ;
 15558                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15559                                  ;
 15560                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15561                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15562                                  ;
 15563                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15564                                  ;
 15565                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15566                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15567                                  ;
 15568                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15569                                  ;
 15570                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15571                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15572                                  ;value.
 15573                                  ;
 15574                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15575                                  ;
 15576                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15577                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15578                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15579                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15580                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15581                                  ;
 15582                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15583                                  ;
 15584                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15585                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15586                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15587                                  ;
 15588                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15589                                  ;
 15590                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15591                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15592                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15593                                  ;
 15594                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15595                                  ;
 15596                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15597                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15598                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15599                                  ;
 15600                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15601                                  ;
 15602                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15603                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15604                                  ;
 15605                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15606                                  ;
 15607                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15608                                  ;
 15609                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15610                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15611                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15612                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15613                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15614                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15615                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15616                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15617                                  ;memory.
 15618                                  ;NOTES:
 15619                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15620                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15621                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15622                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15623                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15624                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15625                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15626                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15627                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15628                                  
 15629                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15630                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15631                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15632                                  
 15633                                  ;include version.inc
 15634                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15635                                  
 15636                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15637                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15638                                  
 15639                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15640                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15641                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15642                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15643                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15644                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15645                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15646                                  
 15647                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15648                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15649                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15650                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15651                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15652                                  
 15653                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15654                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15655                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15656                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15657                                  
 15658                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 15659                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 15660                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 15661                                  
 15662                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15663                                  
 15664                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15665                                  				; currently 0.
 15666                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15667                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15668                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15669                                  
 15670                                  ;      if1
 15671                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15672                                  ;      endif
 15673                                  
 15674                                         ;******************************
 15675                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15676                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15677                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15678                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15679                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15680                                         ;******************************
 15681                                  
 15682                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15683                                  ; device definitions
 15684                                  
 15685                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15686                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15687                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15688                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15689                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15690                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 15691                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 15692                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 15693                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 15694                                  
 15695                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 15696                                  struc	SYSDEV
 15697 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 15698 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 15699 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 15700 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 15701 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 15702                                  .size:
 15703                                  endstruc
 15704                                  
 15705                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 15706                                  struc	SRHEAD
 15707 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 15708 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 15709 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 15710 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 15711 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 15712                                  .size:
 15713                                  endstruc
 15714                                  
 15715                                  ;Status word masks
 15716                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 15717                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 15718                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 15719                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 15720                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 15721                                  
 15722                                  ;Function codes
 15723                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 15724                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 15725                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 15726                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 15727                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 15728                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 15729                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 15730                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 15731                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 15732                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 15733                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 15734                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 15735                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 15736                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 15737                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 15738                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 15739                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 15740                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 15741                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 15742                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 15743                                  
 15744                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15745                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15746 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15747 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15748 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15749 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15750 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15751 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15752                                                          ; word
 15753 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15754 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15755 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15756 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15757                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15758                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15759                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15760                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15761                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15762                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15763                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15764                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15765 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15766 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15767 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15768 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15769 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15770 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15771                                  .size:
 15772                                  endstruc
 15773                                  
 15774                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15775                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15776                                  
 15777                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15778                                  
 15779                                  struc buffinfo
 15780 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15781 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15782 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15783                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15784                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15785 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15786                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15787                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15788                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15789                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15790                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15791                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15792                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15793                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15794 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15795                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15796 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15797 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15798 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15799 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15800 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15801                                  .size:
 15802                                  endstruc
 15803                                  
 15804                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15805                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15806                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15807                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15808                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15809                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15810                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15811                                  
 15812                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15813                                  
 15814                                  
 15815                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15816                                  
 15817                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15818                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15819                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15820                                  ;***
 15821                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15822                                  ;***
 15823                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15824                                  
 15825                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15826                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15827                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15828                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15829                                  
 15830                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 15834                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15835                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15836                                  
 15837                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15838                                  
 15839                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15840                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15841                                  ;
 15842                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15843                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15844                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15845                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15846                                  ;
 15847                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15848                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15849                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15850                                  
 15851                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15852                                  
 15853                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15854                                  
 15855                                  struc	DPB
 15856 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15857 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15858 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15859 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15860 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15861 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15862 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15863 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15864 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15865 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15866                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15867 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15868 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15869 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15870 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15871 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15872                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15873 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15874 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15875 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15876                                  .size:
 15877                                  endstruc
 15878                                  
 15879                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15880                                  
 15881                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 15882

 15938                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15939                                  
 15940                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15941                                  ;
 15942                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15943                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15944                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15945                                  ;
 15946                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15947                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15948                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15949                                  ;
 15950                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15951                                  
 15952                                  struc A_BPB
 15953 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15954 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15955 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15956 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15957 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15958 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15959 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15960 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15961 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15962 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15963 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15964 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15965 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15966 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15967 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15968                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15969                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15970                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15971                                  .size:
 15972                                  endstruc
 15973                                  
 15974                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 15975 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 15976 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15977 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15978 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15979 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15980 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 15981 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 15982 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 15983                                  endstruc

 16018                                  ;** Arena Header
 16019                                  
 16020                                  struc ARENA
 16021 00000000 ??                      .SIGNATURE:	resb 1		; 4D for valid item, 5A for last item

 16231                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16232                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 16233                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16234                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16235                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16236                                  									  
 16237                                  ;*******************************					  
 16238                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16239                                  ;*******************************					  
 16240                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16241                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16242                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16243                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16244                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16245                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16246                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16247                                  ;For all others:							  
 16248                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16249                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16250                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16251                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16252                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16253                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16254                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16255                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16256                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16257                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16258                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16259                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16260                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16261                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16262                                  ;									  
 16263                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16264                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16265                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16266                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16267                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16268                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16269                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16270                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16271                                  ;									  
 16272                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16273                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16274                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16275                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16276                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16277                                  ;									  
 16278                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16279                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16280                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16281                                  ;									  
 16282                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16283                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16284                                  ;									  
 16285                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16286                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16287                                  ;									  
 16288                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16289                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16290                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16291                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16292                                  ;						called. 		  
 16293                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16294                                  ;									  
 16295                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16296                                  ;									  
 16297                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16298                                  ;									  
 16299                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16300                                  ;									  
 16301                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16302                                  ;									  
 16303                                  
 16304                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16305                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16306 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16307 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16308                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16309 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16310 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16311 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1

 16313                                  endstruc

 16422                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16423                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16424                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16425                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16426                                  
 16427                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16428                                  ;
 16429                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16430                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16431                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16432                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16433                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16434                                  ;
 16435                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16436                                  ;
 16437                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16438                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16439                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16440                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16441                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16442                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16443                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16444                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16445                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16446                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16447                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16448                                  
 16449                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16450                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16451                                  
 16452                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16453                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16454 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16455 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16456 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16457 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16458 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16459 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16460                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16461 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)

 16487                                  ; system file table
 16488                                  
 16489                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16490                                  ;
 16491                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16492                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16493                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16494                                  
 16495                                  struc	SF
 16496 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16497 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16498 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16499                                  .size:
 16500                                  endstruc
 16501                                  
 16502                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16503                                  ;
 16504                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16505                                  
 16506                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16507 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16508                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16509 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16510 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16511 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16512                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16513                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16514                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16515                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16516                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16517                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16518                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16519                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16520                                  					;
 16521                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16522                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16523                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16524                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16525                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16526                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16527                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16528                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16529                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16530                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16531                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16532                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16533 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16534                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16535                                  					; points to net device header if
 16536                                  					; remote
 16537 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16538                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16539 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16540 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16541 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16542 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16543                                  ;
 16544                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16545                                  ; ID
 16546                                  ;
 16547 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16548 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16549 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 16550                                  ;
 16551                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 16552                                  ;
 16553 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 16554                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 16555                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 16556                                  					; disk changed errors.
 16557                                  ; SHARING INFO
 16558 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 16559 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 16560 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 16561 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 16562 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed

 16565                                  endstruc

 16836                                  SYSINIT$:
 16837                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 16838                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 16844                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16845                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16846                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16847                                  
 16848                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16849                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16850                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16851                                  
 16852                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16853                                  ;
 16854                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16855                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16856                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16857                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16858                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16859                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16860                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16861                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16862                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16863                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16864                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16865                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16866                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16867                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16868                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16869                                  ;
 16870                                  
 16871                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16872                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16873                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16874                                  ;
 16875                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16876                                  ;
 16877                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16878                                  ;
 16879                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16880                                  ;
 16881                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16882                                  ;
 16883                                  
 16884                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16885                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16886                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16887                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16888                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16889                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16890                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16891                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16892                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16893                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16894                                  
 16895                                  		;EVEN
 16896                                  ;align 2
 16897                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16898                                  
 16899 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16900 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16901 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16902 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16903 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16904 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16905                                  
 16906 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16907 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16908 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16909                                  
 16910                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16911                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16912                                  
 16913                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16914                                  
 16915 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16916                                  
 16917                                  int02:
 16918                                  
 16919                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16920                                  ;
 16921                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16922                                  ;
 16923                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16924                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16925                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16926                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16927                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16928                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16929                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16930                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16931                                  ;
 16932                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16933                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16934                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16935                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16936                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16937                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16938                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16939                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16940                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16941                                  ;
 16942                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16943                                  
 16944 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16945 00000017 06                      	push	es

 17193                                  
 17194                                  ;********************************************************************
 17195                                  ;common routines
 17196                                  ;********************************************************************
 17197                                  
 17198                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 17199                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 17200                                  ; service routine
 17201                                  
 17202                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 17203                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17204                                  
 17205                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 17206                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 17207                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 17208                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 17209                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 17210                                  
 17211                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 17212                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO:SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 17213                                  
 17214                                  do_int_stacks:
 17215 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17216 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17217 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17218 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17219 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 17220 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 17221                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17222                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 17223                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17224 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 17225 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 17226 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 17227                                  
 17228 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 17229                                  
 17230                                  found02:
 17231 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 17232 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 17233                                  
 17234 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 17235                                  
 17236 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 17237                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17238                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 17239                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17240                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 17241 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 17242 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 17243                                  
 17244                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 17245 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 17246 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 17247 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 17248 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 17249 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 17250 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 17251 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17252 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 17253                                  
 17254                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 17255                                  	;push    bp
 17256                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 17257                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 17258                                  	;pop     bp
 17259                                  	;push    es
 17260                                  	;pop     ss
 17261                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 17262                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 17263                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17264                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 17265                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 17266                                  
 17267 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 17268                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17269 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 17270                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17271                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17272                                  
 17273 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17274                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17275 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 17276                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17277                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17278 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17279 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17280                                  
 17281                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17282                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 17283                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17284 0000019E 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 17285 000001A3 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 17286                                  
 17287 000001A8 07                      	pop	es
 17288 000001A9 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 17289 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 17290 000001AB 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 17291 000001AE CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 17292                                  
 17293                                  notfree02:
 17294 000001AF 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 17295 000001B1 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 17296                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17297                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 17298                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17299 000001B3 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17300                                  
 17301                                  findnext02:
 17302 000001B7 E81200                  	call	longpath
 17303 000001BA EBA8                    	jmp	short found02
 17304                                  
 17305                                  foundbad02:
 17306 000001BC 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17307 000001C1 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 17308 000001C3 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 17309                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17310                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 17311                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17312 000001C5 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 17313 000001CA EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 17314                                  
 17315                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17316                                  
 17317                                  ; Common routines
 17318                                  
 17319                                  longpath:
 17320                                  	; 21/03/2019
 17321 000001CC 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 17322                                  lploopp:
 17323                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17324                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 17325                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17326 000001D1 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 17327 000001D6 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 17328                                  
 17329 000001D8 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 17330                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17331                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 17332                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17333 000001DA 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17334 000001DE 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 17335 000001E0 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 17336                                  
 17337 000001E2 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 17338 000001E4 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 17339                                  
 17340                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17341                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 17342                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17343 000001E6 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 17344                                  inuse:
 17345 000001EA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17346 000001EF 7406                    	je	short fatal
 17347 000001F1 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 17348 000001F4 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 17349                                  found:
 17350 000001F6 C3                      	retn
 17351                                  fatal:
 17352 000001F7 1E                      	push	ds
 17353 000001F8 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 17354 000001FB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17355 000001FD 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 17356 00000202 1F                      	pop	ds
 17357 00000203 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 17358                                  
 17359 00000205 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 17360 00000207 E672                    	out	72h,al
 17361                                  
 17362                                  skip_nmis:
 17363 00000209 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 17364 0000020A B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 17365 0000020C E621                    	out	021h,al
 17366 0000020E E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 17367                                  
 17368 00000210 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 17369 00000212 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 17370 00000214 BE[3B02]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 17371                                  ;SR;
 17372                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 17373                                  ;
 17374 00000217 50                      	push	ax
 17375 00000218 1E                      	push	ds
 17376                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 17377                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 17378                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17379 00000219 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 17380 0000021C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17381                                  
 17382                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 17383 0000021E F606[6F08]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 17384 00000223 1F                      	pop	ds
 17385 00000224 58                      	pop	ax
 17386 00000225 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 17387                                  
 17388                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)
 17389                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 17390                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17391 00000227 9A[7008]7000            	call	DOSBIODATASEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; 0070h:08D1h
 17392                                  ;
 17393                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 17394                                  ;
 17395                                  fatal_loop:
 17396 0000022C AC                      	lodsb
 17397 0000022D 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 17398 0000022F 7408                    	je	short fatal_done
 17399                                  
 17400 00000231 B307                    	mov	bl,7
 17401 00000233 B40E                    	mov	ah,14
 17402 00000235 CD10                    	int	10h			; whoops, this enables ints
 17403 00000237 EBF3                    	jmp	short fatal_loop
 17404                                  
 17405                                  fatal_done:
 17406 00000239 EBFE                    	jmp	short fatal_done
 17407                                  
 17408                                  
 17409                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSINIT1.ASM, 1991)
 17410                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17411                                  ;	include msbio.cl5		; fatal stack error message
 17412                                  
 17413                                  ; MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS, SYSINIT:023Bh
 17414                                  
 17415                                  ; STKMES.INC - MSDOS 3.3 (24/07/1987)
 17416                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 17418                                  
 17419                                  fatal_msg:
 17420 0000023B 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 17421 0000023D 070D0A                  	db	7,0Dh,0Ah
 17422 00000240 496E7465726E616C20-     	db	"Internal stack overflow",0Dh,0Ah
 17422 00000249 737461636B206F7665-

 18367                                  ;	cas note: this unorthodox paragraph rounding scheme wastes a byte
 18368                                  ;	  if [singlebuffersize] ever happens to be zero mod 16. Could this
 18369                                  ;	  ever happen? Only if the buffer overhead was zero mod 16, since
 18370                                  ;	  it is probably safe to assume that the sector size always will be.
 18371                                  ;
 18372                                  ;	 mohans also found a bug in CONFIG.SYS processing where it replaces
 18373                                  ;	  EOF's with cr,lf's, without checking for collision with [confbot].
 18374                                  ;	  perhaps the extra byte this code guarantees is what has kept that

 18609                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18610                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18611                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18612                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18613                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18614                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18615                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18616                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18617                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18618                                  ;
 18619                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18620                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18621                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18622                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18623                                  ; been patched.
 18624                                  
 18625                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0

 18939                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"

 18941                                  ;   which follow....)

 18943                                  retry:
 18944 00000782 BA[5846]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18945                                  
 18946                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18947                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18948                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18949                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18950                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18951                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18952                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18953                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18954                                  
 18955                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18956                                  
 18957 00000785 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18958 00000786 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 18960 0000078B CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 18961 0000078D B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18962 0000078F CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 18963 00000791 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 18964                                  
 18965 00000793 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18966 00000795 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 18967 00000797 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 18968 00000799 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18969                                  
 18970                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18971                                  
 18972                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18973                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18974                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18975                                  
 18976                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18977                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 18979 0000079F 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18980                                  
 18981                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18982                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18983                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18984                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18985                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18986                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18987                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18988                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18989                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18990                                  ;
 18991                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18992                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18993                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18994                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18995                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18996                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18997                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18998

 19314                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19315                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 19316                                  ;
 19317                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 19318                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 19319                                  ;
 19320                                  ; Inputs : None
 19321                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 19322                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 19323                                  ;	   free memory.
 19324                                  ;
 19325                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 19326                                  ;
 19327                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19328                                  	
 19329                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2

 19337 000008F2 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC

 19339                                  	; 11/12/2022

 19341                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 19342                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to

 19344 000008F9 A3[6403]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 19345 000008FC C3                      	retn				; start of free memory

 19832                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19833                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19834                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19835                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19836                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19837                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19838                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19839                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19840                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19841                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19842                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19843                                  ;
 19844                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19845                                  
 19846                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19847                                  update_arena:
 19848 00000A1C 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19849 00000A1D 57                      	push	di
 19850 00000A1E 51                      	push	cx
 19851 00000A1F 52                      	push	dx
 19852                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19853                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19854                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19855                                  	; ds = cs 
 19856 00000A20 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19857 00000A24 4F                      	dec	di
 19858 00000A25 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19859                                  						;  before sysvar
 19860 00000A26 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19861                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19862 00000A28 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19863 00000A2D 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19864 00000A2F 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19865                                  
 19866                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19867 00000A31 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19868 00000A36 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19869 00000A38 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19870 00000A3A 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19871 00000A3C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19872                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19873 00000A3E 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19874                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19875 00000A42 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19876 00000A48 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19877                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19878 00000A4A 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19879 00000A4E 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
