 19881                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19882 00000A50 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19883 00000A53 5A                      	pop	dx
 19884 00000A54 59                      	pop	cx
 19885 00000A55 5F                      	pop	di
 19886 00000A56 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19887 00000A57 C3                      	retn

 19910                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19911                                  ;
 19912                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19913                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19914                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19915                                  ;
 19916                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19917                                  ;
 19918                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19919                                  
 19920                                  AllocHMA:
 19921                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19922                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19923                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19924                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19925                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19926                                  
 19927                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19928                                  ;
 19929                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19930                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19931                                  ;	push	ax
 19932                                  ;	popf
 19933                                  ;	pushf
 19934                                  ;	pop	ax
 19935                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)

 19937                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19938                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19939                                  
 19940                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19941                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)

 19956                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point

 20079                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20080                                  ;
 20081                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20082                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20083                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20084                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20085                                  ;
 20086                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20087                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20088                                  ;
 20089                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20090                                  
 20091                                  StartVDHead:
 20092                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20093                                  
 20094 00000ADC 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20095 00000AE0 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20096 00000AE2 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20097 00000AE4 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20098 00000AE6 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20099                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20100 00000AE7 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20101                                  VDiskSig1:
 20102 00000AEE 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20103                                  
 20104                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20105                                  
 20106 00000AF3 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20107                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20108 00000AF9 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20109 00000B08 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20110 00000B0A 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20111                                  VDInt19:
 20112 00000B0B EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20113                                  OldVDInt19:
 20114 00000B0C 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20115                                  
 20116                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20117                                  
 20118                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20119 00000B10 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20120                                  VDiskSig2:
 20121 00000B13 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20122                                  
 20123                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20124                                  
 20125 00000B18 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20126 00000B1B 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20127 00000B1D 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20128 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20129 00000B20 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20130 00000B21 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20131 00000B23 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20132 00000B25 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20133 00000B26 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20134 00000B28 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20135 00000B2A 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20136 00000B2C 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20137 00000B2E 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20138                                  
 20139                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 20140                                  
 20141                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20142                                  ;
 20143                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20144                                  ;
 20145                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20146                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20147                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20148                                  ;
 20149                                  ; Inputs : None
 20150                                  ;
 20151                                  ; Outputs : None
 20152                                  ;
 20153                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20154                                  ;
 20155                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20156                                  
 20157                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20158                                  
 20159                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20160 00000B30 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20161 00000B32 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20162                                  
 20163                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20164                                  
 20165                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20166 00000B34 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20167                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20168 00000B37 2EA3[0C0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20169 00000B3B A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20170                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20171 00000B3E 2EA3[0E0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20172                                  
 20173                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20174                                  
 20175 00000B42 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20176                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20177                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20178 00000B44 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20179 00000B47 CD21                    	int	21h
 20180                                  
 20181                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20182                                  
 20183 00000B49 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20184 00000B4A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20185                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20186 00000B4C 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20187                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20188 00000B53 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20189 00000B5A 40                      	inc	ax
 20190 00000B5B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20191                                  
 20192                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20193                                  
 20194 00000B5D FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20195                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20196 00000B5E C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20197 00000B64 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20198                                  
 20199                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20200                                  
 20201                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20202 00000B67 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20203 00000B6A BE[DC0A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20204 00000B6D 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20205 00000B6F 0E                      	push	cs
 20206 00000B70 1F                      	pop	ds
 20207 00000B71 FC                      	cld
 20208 00000B72 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20209 00000B74 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20210                                  
 20211                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20212                                  
 20213                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20214 00000B75 57                      	push	di
 20215 00000B76 06                      	push	es
 20216                                  
 20217 00000B77 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20218 00000B7A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20219 00000B7C BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20220                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20221 00000B7F B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20222 00000B82 BE[100B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20223 00000B85 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20224                                  
 20225 00000B87 5F                      	pop	di
 20226 00000B88 07                      	pop	es
 20227                                  
 20228 00000B89 C3                      	retn

 20235                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session

 20275                                  
 20276                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20277                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20278                                  
 20279                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20280                                  
 20281                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20282                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20283                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20284                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20285                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20286                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20287                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20288                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20289                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20290                                  ;								      ;I070
 20291                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20292                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20293                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20294                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20295                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070

 20344                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20345                                  ;
 20346                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20347                                  ;
 20348                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20349                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20350                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20351                                  ;		the offset.
 20352                                  ;
 20353                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20354                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20355                                  ;
 20356                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20357                                  
 20358                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:

 20360 00000C04 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 20361 00000C07 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20362 00000C09 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 20363 00000C0C 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20364 00000C0F B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20365 00000C11 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20366 00000C13 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20367 00000C15 1E                      	push	ds
 20368                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20369                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20370                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20371 00000C16 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20372 00000C19 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20373 00000C1B 893E[9608]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20374 00000C1F C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20375 00000C24 1F                      	pop	ds
 20376 00000C25 C3                      	retn

 20416                                  ;
 20417                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20418                                  ;
 20419                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20420                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20421                                  ;
 20422                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20423                                  
 20424                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20425                                  CPMHack:
 20426 00000C4E 1E                      	push	ds
 20427 00000C4F B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20428 00000C52 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20429                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20430                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20431 00000C54 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20432 00000C55 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20433 00000C57 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20434 00000C5A BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20435                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20436 00000C5D B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20437 00000C5F FC                      	cld
 20438 00000C60 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20439 00000C62 1F                      	pop	ds
 20440 00000C63 C3                      	retn

 21323                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21324                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21325                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21326                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21327                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21328                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21329                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21330                                  ;
 21331                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21332                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21333                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21334                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21335                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21336                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21337                                  ;
 21338                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21339                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21340                                  ;
 21341                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21342                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21343                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21344                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21345                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21346                                  ;
 21347                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21348                                  ;
 21349                                  ;			  none.
 21350                                  
 21351                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21352                                  ;
 21353                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21354                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21355                                  
 21356                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21357                                  
 21358 00001001 50                      	push	ax
 21359 00001002 53                      	push	bx

 21361 00001004 06                      	push	es

 21364 00001007 BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 21365 0000100A EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 21366 0000100B 42                      	inc	dx

 21372 00001011 42                      	inc	dx

 21399 00001035 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address

 21560                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21561                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21562                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21563                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21564                                  ;
 21565                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21566                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21567                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21568                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21569                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21570                                  ; program).
 21571                                  
 21572                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21573                                  
 21574                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21575                                  
 21576 000010E9 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21577                                  
 21578                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21579                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21580                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21581                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21582                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21583                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21584                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21585                                  ; carridge return.
 21586                                  
 21587                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21588                                  ;character after =.
 21589                                  
 21590 000010EA 06                      	push	es
 21591 000010EB 1E                      	push	ds
 21592 000010EC 07                      	pop	es
 21593 000010ED 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21594 000010EE 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21595                                  
 21596 000010F0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21597 000010F2 FC                      	cld
 21598 000010F3 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21599 000010F9 BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21600                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21601 000010FC AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21602 000010FD 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21603 000010FF 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21604 00001101 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21605                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21606 00001103 AC                      	lodsb
 21607 00001104 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21608 00001107 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21609 00001109 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21610 0000110B FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21611 0000110D 47                      	inc	di
 21612 0000110E EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21613                                  done_installparm:
 21614 00001110 2E880E[F002]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21615 00001115 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then

 21723                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21724                                  ;
 21725                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21726                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21727                                  ;
 21728                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21729                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21730                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21731                                  
 21732                                  ParaRound:
 21733 0000116A 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21734 0000116D D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21735 0000116F D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21736 00001171 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21737 00001173 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21738 00001175 C3                      	retn

 21740                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21741                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21742                                  ;
 21743                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21744                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21745                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21746                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21747                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21748                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21749                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21750                                  ;
 21751                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21752                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21753                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21754                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21755                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21756                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21757                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21758                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21759                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21760                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21761                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21762                                  ;
 21763                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21764                                  
 21765                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21766                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21767                                  sysinit_base:				
 21768 00001176 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21769 0000117B 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21770 00001180 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21771 00001182 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21772 00001187 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21773 0000118C 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21774 0000118D 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21775 0000118E 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21776                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21777                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21778 00001190 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21779 00001193 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21780 00001198 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21781                                  
 21782                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21783                                  
 21784 0000119A B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21785 0000119C 0E                      	push	cs
 21786 0000119D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21787                                  	; 30/12/2022
 21788                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 21789                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 21790 0000119E BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21791                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21792 000011A1 CD21                    	int	21h
 21793                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21794                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21795                                  
 21796                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21797                                  stall:
 21798                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21799                                  _stall: 
 21800                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21801 000011A3 F4                      	hlt 
 21802                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21803                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21804 000011A4 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21805                                  
 21806                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21807 000011A6 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21808                                  
 21809                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21810                                  
 21811                                  sum_up:
 21812                                  
 21813                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21814                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21815                                  ;
 21816                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21817                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21818                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21819                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21820                                  ;
 21821                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21822                                  
 21823 000011AB 1E                      	push	ds
 21824                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21825                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 21826 000011AC 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21827                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21828                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21829 000011B0 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21830 000011B2 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21831 000011B4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21832 000011B6 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21833                                  					; whole test better fail.
 21834 000011BB D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21835 000011BD 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21836                                  sum1:
 21837 000011BF 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21838 000011C1 46                      	inc	si
 21839 000011C2 46                      	inc	si
 21840 000011C3 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21841                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21842                                  sum_sys_code:
 21843                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21844 000011C5 BEC411                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21845                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21846                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21847                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21848                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21849                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21850                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21851                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 21852 000011C8 B9[204E]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21853 000011CB 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21854 000011CD D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21855                                  sum2:
 21856 000011CF 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21857 000011D2 46                      	inc	si
 21858 000011D3 46                      	inc	si
 21859 000011D4 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21860 000011D6 1F                      	pop	ds
 21861 000011D7 C3                      	retn

 21863                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21864                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21865                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 21866                                  
 21867                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)

 21872 000011DA 0000                    	dw	0

 21959                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21960                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21961                                  ;
 21962                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21963                                  ;

 21965                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 21969                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21970 00001251 53                      	push	bx
 21971 00001252 52                      	push	dx
 21972 00001253 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21973 00001257 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21974                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21975 0000125C 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21976                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21977                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21978                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21979 0000125F 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21980 00001261 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21981 00001263 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21982                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21983 00001266 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21984 00001268 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21985 0000126B 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21986 0000126D BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21987                                  	;zf=1
 21988                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21989                                  	;zf=1
 21990 00001270 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21991                                  got_hma:
 21992 00001275 5A                      	pop	dx
 21993 00001276 5B                      	pop	bx
 21994 00001277 C3                      	retn

 22019 00001293 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22020                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22021 00001299 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0

 22024                                  ; ======================================================================
 22025                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22026                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22027                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22028                                  
 22029                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22030                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22031                                  ;
 22032                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22033                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22034                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22035                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22036                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22037                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22038                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22039                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22040                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22041                                  ;
 22042                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22043                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22044                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22045                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22046                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22047                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22048                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22049                                  ;	conditions:
 22050                                  ;
 22051                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22052                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22053                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22054                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22055                                  ;
 22056                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22057                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22058                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22059                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22060                                  ;
 22061                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22062                                  ;
 22063                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22064                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22065                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22066                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22067                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22068                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22069                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22070                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22071                                  ;
 22072                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22073                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22074                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22075                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22076                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22077                                  ;
 22078                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22079                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22080                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22081                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22082                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22083                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22084                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22085                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22086                                  ;
 22087                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22088                                  
 22089                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22090                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22091                                  
 22092                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22093                                  stackinit:
 22094 000012A0 50                      	push	ax
 22095 000012A1 1E                      	push	ds
 22096 000012A2 06                      	push	es
 22097 000012A3 53                      	push	bx
 22098 000012A4 51                      	push	cx
 22099 000012A5 52                      	push	dx
 22100 000012A6 57                      	push	di
 22101 000012A7 56                      	push	si
 22102 000012A8 55                      	push	bp
 22103                                  
 22104                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22105                                  
 22106                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22107                                  	; ds = cs
 22108 000012A9 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22109 000012AC 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22110                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22111                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22112                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22113 000012AE 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22114                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22115 000012B2 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22116 000012B5 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22117                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22118 000012B9 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22119                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22120                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22121                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22122 000012BC 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22123                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22124 000012C0 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22125 000012C2 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22126                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22127                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22128                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22129 000012C5 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22130                                  
 22131                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22132                                  
 22133                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22134                                  
 22135                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22136                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22137                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22138 000012C9 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22139                                  
 22140                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22141                                  
 22142 000012CE B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22143                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22144                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22145                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22146 000012D1 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22147 000012D3 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22148 000012D5 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22149 000012D9 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22150 000012DB 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22151                                  
 22152                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22153                                  
 22154 000012DE 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22155 000012E3 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22156 000012E7 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22157 000012E9 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22158 000012EB 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22159 000012ED 06                      	push	es
 22160 000012EE 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22161                                  
 22162                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22163                                  
 22164 000012EF 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22165 000012F3 FC                      	cld
 22166 000012F4 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22167                                  
 22168 000012F6 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22169                                  
 22170                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22171                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22172                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22173                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22174                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22175                                  
 22176                                  buildloop:
 22177                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22178                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22179                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22180                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 22181                                  	; 06/07/2023
 22182 000012FA 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free
 22183 000012FE 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 22184                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 22185 00001302 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax
 22186                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 22187 00001306 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 22188                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 22189 0000130A 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]
 22190 0000130E 26895E06                	mov	[es:bp+newsp],bx		; mov [es:bp+6],bx
 22191                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx
 22192 00001312 26892F                  	mov	[es:bx],bp
 22193 00001315 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22194                                  
 22195 00001318 E2E0                    	loop	buildloop
 22196                                  
 22197 0000131A 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22198 0000131D 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 22199 00001321 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 22200                                  
 22201 00001325 1E                      	push	ds
 22202 00001326 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 22203 00001329 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22204 0000132B 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 22205 00001330 1F                      	pop	ds
 22206 00001331 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 22207                                  
 22208 00001333 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable convertible nmis
 22209 00001335 E672                    	out	72h,al
 22210                                  
 22211                                  skip_disablenmis:
 22212 00001337 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22213 00001339 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			;es - segid of vector table at 0
 22214                                  					;ds - relocated stack code segment
 22215 0000133B FA                      	cli
 22216                                  
 22217                                  	;irp	aa,<02,08,09,70>
 22218                                  	;

 22926                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22927                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22928                                  
 22929                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22930                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22931                                  
 22932                                  new_init_loop:
 22933                                  
 22934                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22935                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22936                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22937                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22938                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22939                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22940                                  
 22941 00001494 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22942 00001497 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22943 00001499 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22944 0000149D 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22945                                  
 22946 000014A0 1E                      	push	ds
 22947                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22948                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22949                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22950 000014A1 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22951 000014A4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22952 000014A6 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22953 000014A9 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22954 000014AB 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22955 000014AF 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22956 000014B2 1F                      	pop	ds
 22957                                  
 22958 000014B3 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22959 000014B6 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22960 000014BA C3                      	retn
 22961                                  
 22962                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22963                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22964                                  
 22965                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22966                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22967                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22968                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22969                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22970                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22971                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22972                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22973                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22974                                  
 22975                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22976                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22977                                  
 22978                                  setdevmark:
 22979                                  
 22980 000014BB 06                      	push	es
 22981 000014BC 51                      	push	cx
 22982                                  
 22983 000014BD 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22984 000014C2 2E890E[E214]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22985 000014C7 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22986                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22987                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22988 000014C9 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22989 000014CD 41                      	inc	cx
 22990                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22991 000014CE 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22992                                  
 22993 000014D3 59                      	pop	cx
 22994 000014D4 07                      	pop	es
 22995 000014D5 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22996 000014DA C3                      	retn

 23197                                  
 23198                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23199                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23200                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23201                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23202                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23203                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23204                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23205                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 23206                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23207                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23208                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23209                                  
 23210                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23211                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23212 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 23213 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 23214 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23215                                  endstruc
 23216                                  
 23217                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 23218                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 23219                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 23220                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 23221                                  
 23222                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23223                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 23224                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 23225                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 23226                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 23227                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23228                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 23229                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 23230                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 23231                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 23232                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 23233                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23234                                  
 23235                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23236                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23237 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23238 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23239 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23240                                  endstruc
 23241                                  
 23242                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23243                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23244                                  ;
 23245                                  ;
 23246                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23247                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23248                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23249                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23250                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23251                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23252                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23253                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23254                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23255                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23256                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23257                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23258                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23259                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23260                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23261                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23262                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23263                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23264                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23265                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23266                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23267                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23268                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23269                                  ;	   :
 23270                                  ;
 23271                                  ;Note:
 23272                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23273                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23274                                  ;
 23275                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23276                                  ;
 23277                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23278                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23279                                  ;
 23280                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23281                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23282                                  ;
 23283                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23284                                  ;
 23285                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23286                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23287                                  ;
 23288                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23289                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23290                                  ;
 23291                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23292                                  ;
 23293                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23294                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23295                                  ;
 23296                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23297                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23298                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23299                                  ;
 23300                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23301                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23302                                  ;
 23303                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23304                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23305                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23306                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23307                                  
 23308                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23309                                  
 23310                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23311                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23312                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23313                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23314                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23315                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23316                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23317                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23318                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23319                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23320                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23321                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23322                                  
 23323                                  ;**** Function flags
 23324                                  
 23325                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23326                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23327                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23328                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23329                                  
 23330                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23331                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23332 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23333 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23334 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23335 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23336 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23337 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23338                                  endstruc
 23339                                  
 23340                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23341                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23342                                  ;
 23343                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23344                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23345                                  ;	     +-
 23346                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23347                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23348                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23349                                  ;	     |	:
 23350                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23351                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23352                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23353                                  ;	     |	:
 23354                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23355                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23356                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23357                                  ;	     +-	:
 23358                                  ;
 23359                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23360                                  ;
 23361                                  ;Note:
 23362                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23363                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23364                                  ;
 23365                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23366                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23367                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23368                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23369                                  
 23370                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23371                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23372                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23373                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23374                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23375                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23376                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23377                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23378                                  
 23379                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23380 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23381 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23382 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23383 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23384 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23385                                  endstruc
 23386                                  
 23387                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23388                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23389                                  ;
 23390                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23391                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23392                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23393                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23394                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23395                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23396                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23397                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23398                                  ;
 23399                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23400                                  ;
 23401                                  ;            +-
 23402                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23403                                  ;	    | or
 23404                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23405                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23406                                  ;	    | or
 23407                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23408                                  ;	    | or
 23409                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23410                                  ;	    | or
 23411                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23412                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23413                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23414                                  ;	    | or
 23415                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23416                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23417                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23418                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23419                                  ;	    +-
 23420                                  ;
 23421                                  ;
 23422                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23423                                  ;      list.
 23424                                  ;
 23425                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23426                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23427                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23428                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23429                                  
 23430                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23431                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 23432 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23433 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23434 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23435 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23436                                  endstruc

 23465                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23466                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error

 23551                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
