 23553                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23554                                  ; SysParse;
 23555                                  ;
 23556                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23557                                  ;
 23558                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23559                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23560                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23561                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23562                                  ;
 23563                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23564                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23565                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23566                                  ;
 23567                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23568                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23569                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23570                                  ;
 23571                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23572                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23573                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23574                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23575                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23576                                  ;
 23577                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23578                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23579                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23580                                  ;
 23581                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23582                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23583                                  ;
 23584                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23585                                  ;
 23586                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23587                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23588                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23589                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23590                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23591                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23592                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23593                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23594                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23595                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23596                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23597                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23598                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23599                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23600                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23601                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23602                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23603                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23604                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23605                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23606                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23607                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23608                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23609                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23610                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23611                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23612                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23613                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23614                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23615                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23616                                  
 23617                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23618                                  
 23619                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23620                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23621                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23622                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23623                                  
 23624                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23625                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23626                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23627                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23628                                  ;
 23629                                  
 23630                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23631                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23632                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23633                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23634                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23635                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23636                                  
 23637                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23638                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23639                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23640                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23641                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23642                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23643                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23644                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23645                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23646                                  
 23647                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23648                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23649                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23650                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23651                                  ;	     segment.
 23652                                  
 23653                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 23654                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 23655                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 23656                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 23657                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 23658                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 23659                                  
 23660                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 23661                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 23662                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 23663                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 23664                                  
 23665                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 23666                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 23667                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 23668                                  
 23669                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 23670                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 23671                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.
 23672                                  ;	     (apostrophe) _$P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
 23673                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 23674                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 23675                                  
 23676                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 23677                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 23678                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 23679                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 23680                                  
 23681                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 23682                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 23683                                  
 23684                                  ;	     The code and PSDATA.INC have been aligned for ease of reading.
 23685                                  
 23686                                  ; 10/26/87 : Ed K (;AN026;) PTM2041, DATE within SWITCH, BX reference to
 23687                                  ;	     psdata buffer should have cs.
 23688                                  
 23689                                  ; 10/27/87 : Ed K (;AN027;) PTM2042 comma between keywords implies
 23690                                  ;	     positional missing.
 23691                                  
 23692                                  ; 11/06/87 : Ed K (;AN028;) PTM 2315 Parser should not use line feed
 23693                                  ;	     as a line delimiter, should use carriage return.
 23694                                  ;	     Define switch: LFEOLSW, if on, accept LF as end of line char.
 23695                                  
 23696                                  ; 11/11/87 : Ed K (;AN029;) PTM 1651 GET RID OF WHITESPACE AROUND "=".
 23697                                  
 23698                                  ; 11/18/87 : Ed K (;AN030;) PTM 2551 If filename is just "", then
 23699                                  ;	     endless loop since SI is returned still pointing to start
 23700                                  ;	     of that parm.
 23701                                  
 23702                                  ; 11/19/87 : Ed K (;AN031;) PTM 2585 date & time getting bad values.
 23703                                  ;	     Vector to returned string has CS instead of cs, but
 23704                                  ;	     when tried to fix it on previous version, changed similar
 23705                                  ;	     but wrong place.
 23706                                  
 23707                                  ; 12/09/87 : Bill L (;AN032;) PTM 2772 colon and period are now valid
 23708                                  ;	     delimiters between hours, minutes, seconds for time. And period
 23709                                  ;	     and comma are valid delimiters between seconds and 100th second.
 23710                                  
 23711                                  ; 12/14/87 : Bill L (;AN033;) PTM 2722 if illegal delimiter characters
 23712                                  ;	     in a filespec, then flag an error.
 23713                                  
 23714                                  ; 12/22/87 : Bill L (;AN034;)	    All local data to parser is now
 23715                                  ;	     indexed off of the cs equate instead of the DS register.
 23716                                  ;	     Using this method, DS can point to the segment of PSP or to psdata
 23717                                  ;  -->	     local parser data. Why were some references to local data changed
 23718                                  ;	     to do this before, but not all ?????

 23748                                  SysParse:
 23749 00001590 2EC706[F714]0000        	mov	word [cs:_$P_Flags],0	;AC034; Clear all internal flags
 23750 00001597 FC                      	cld				;AN000; confirm forward direction
 23751 00001598 2E890E[EA14]            	mov	word [cs:_$P_ORDINAL],cx ;AC034; save operand ordinal
 23752 0000159D 2EC706[EC14]0000        	mov	word [cs:_$P_RC],_$P_No_Error ;AC034; Assume no error
 23753 000015A4 2EC706[FF14]0000        	mov	word [cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM],0 ;AC034; initalize synonym pointer
 23754                                  
 23755 000015AB 2EC706[F014]0000        	mov	word [cs:_$P_DX],0	;AC034; (tm15)
 23756                                  
 23757                                  ;M029 -- Begin changes
 23758                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 23759                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 23760                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 23761                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 23762                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 23763                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
 23764                                  
 23765                                  ;IF FileSW + DrvSW
 23766 000015B2 2EC706[8615]5D5B        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char], ']['
 23767 000015B9 2EC706[8815]3C7C        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+2], '<|'
 23768 000015C0 2EC706[8A15]2B3E        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+4], '+>'
 23769 000015C7 2EC706[8C15]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='
 23770                                  ;ENDIFtHHH
 23771                                  
 23772                                  ;M029 -- End of changes
 23773

 23775 000015D1 7313                    	jnc	short _$P_Start		;AN000; If EOL is not encountered, do parse
 23776                                  ;--------------------------- End of Line

 23790 000015E3 E91F01                  	jmp	_$P_Single_Exit		;AN000; return to the caller
 23791                                  ;---------------------------
 23792                                  _$P_Start:				;AN000;
 23793 000015E6 2E8936[F914]            	mov	[cs:_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx],si ;AN000;AC034; save ptr to command line for later use by complex,
 23794 000015EB 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; quoted string or file spec.
 23795 000015EC 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 23796 000015ED 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 23797                                  	;lea	bx,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF] ;AC034; set buffer to copy from command string
 23798                                  	; 02/11/2022
 23799 000015EE 8D1E[0115]              	lea	bx,[_$P_STRING_BUF]
 23800 000015F2 2EF606[F814]20          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra ;AC034; 3/9 extra delimiter encountered ?
 23801 000015F8 7543                    	jnz	short _$P_Pack_End	;AN000; 3/9 if yes, no need to copy
 23802                                  
 23803                                  _$P_Pack_Loop:				;AN000;
 23804 000015FA AC                      	lodsb				;AN000; Pick a operand from buffer
 23805 000015FB E81207                  	call	_$P_Chk_Switch		;AN000; Check switch character
 23806 000015FE 723C                    	jc	short _$P_Pack_End_BY_EOL ;AN020; if carry set found delimiter type slash, need backup si, else continue
 23807                                  
 23808 00001600 E88A06                  	call	_$P_Chk_EOL		;AN000; Check EOL character
 23809 00001603 7437                    	je	short _$P_Pack_End_BY_EOL ;AN000; need backup si
 23810                                  
 23811 00001605 E8BA06                  	call	_$P_Chk_Delim		;AN000; Check delimiter
 23812 00001608 7518                    	jne	short _$P_PL01 		;AN000; If no, process next byte
 23813                                  
 23814 0000160A 2EF606[F814]20          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra ;AC034; 3/9 If yes and white spec,
 23815                                  ; (tm08)jne	short _$P_Pack_End	;AN000; 3/9 then
 23816 00001610 7505                    	jnz	short _$P_Pack_End_backup_si ;AN000; (tm08)
 23817                                  
 23818 00001612 E85606                  	call	_$P_Skip_Delim		;AN000; skip subsequent white space,too
 23819 00001615 EB26                    	jmp	short _$P_Pack_End	;AN000; finish copy by placing NUL at end
 23820                                  
 23821                                  _$P_Pack_End_backup_si:			;AN000; (tm08)
 23822 00001617 2EF606[F814]41          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW+_$P_equ ;AN000;AC034;  (tm08)
 23823 0000161D 741E                    	jz	short _$P_Pack_End	;AN000; (tm08)
 23824                                  
 23825 0000161F 4E                      	dec	si			;AN000; (tm08)
 23826 00001620 EB1B                    	jmp	short _$P_Pack_End	;AN025; (tm08)
 23827                                  
 23828                                  _$P_PL01:				;AN000;
 23829 00001622 2E8807                  	mov	[cs:bx],al		;AN000; move byte to STRING_BUF
 23830 00001625 3C3D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Keyword  ;'='	;AN000; if it is equal character,
 23831 00001627 7506                    	jne	short _$P_PL00 		;AN000; then
 23832                                  
 23833 00001629 2E800E[F814]01          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AC034; remember it in flag
 23834                                  _$P_PL00:				;AN000;
 23835 0000162F 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000; ready to see next byte
 23836 00001630 E8F606                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; was it 1st byte of DBCS ?
 23837 00001633 73C5                    	jnc	_$P_Pack_Loop		;AN000; if no, process to next byte
 23838                                  
 23839 00001635 AC                      	lodsb				;AN000; if yes, store
 23840 00001636 2E8807                  	mov	[cs:bx],al		;AN000;    2nd byte of DBCS
 23841 00001639 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000; update pointer
 23842 0000163A EBBE                    	jmp	short _$P_Pack_Loop	;AN000; process to next byte
 23843                                  
 23844                                  _$P_Pack_End_BY_EOL:			;AN000;
 23845 0000163C 4E                      	dec	si			;AN000; backup si pointer
 23846                                  _$P_Pack_End:				;AN000;
 23847 0000163D 2E8936[EE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_SI_Save],si     ;AC034; save next pointer, SI
 23848 00001642 2EC60700                	mov	byte [cs:bx],_$P_NULL	;AN000; put NULL at the end
 23849 00001646 2E891E[FD14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_Save_EOB],bx    ;AC034; 3/17/87 keep the address for later use of complex
 23850                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.PARMSX_Address] ;AN000; get PARMSX address

 23853                                  	; 02/11/2022
 23854 0000164E 8D36[0115]              	lea	si,[_$P_STRING_BUF]
 23855 00001652 2E803C2F                	cmp	byte [cs:si],_$P_Switch ;AN000; the operand begins w/ switch char ?
 23856 00001656 7436                    	je	short _$P_SW_Manager	;AN000; if yes, process as switch
 23857                                  
 23858 00001658 2E803C22                	cmp	byte [cs:si],_$P_DQuote	;M005;is it a string?
 23859 0000165C 7408                    	je	short _$P_Positional_Manager ;M005;if so, process as one!
 23860                                  
 23861 0000165E 2EF606[F814]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AC034; the operand includes equal char ?
 23862 00001664 7552                    	jnz	short _$P_Key_Manager	;AN000; if yes, process as keyword
 23863                                  
 23864                                  _$P_Positional_Manager:			;AN000; else process as positional
 23865 00001666 268A4701                	mov	al,[es:bx+_$P_PARMSX_Blk.MaxP] ;AN000; get maxp
 23866 0000166A 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000; ax = maxp
 23867 0000166C 2E3906[EA14]            	cmp	[cs:_$P_ORDINAL],ax	;AC034; too many positional ?
 23868 00001671 7312                    	jae	short _$P_Too_Many_Error ;AN000; if yes, set exit code to too many
 23869                                  
 23870 00001673 2EA1[EA14]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_ORDINAL]	;AC034; see what the current ordinal

 23872 00001679 43                      	inc	bx			;AC035; add '2' to

 23884                                  _$P_SW_Manager:				;AN000;
 23885 0000168E 268A4701                	mov	al,[es:bx+_$P_PARMSX_Blk.MaxP] ;AN000; get maxp

 23887 00001694 40                      	inc	ax			;AN000;
 23888 00001695 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1			;AN000; ax = (ax+1)*2
 23889 00001697 01C3                    	add	bx,ax			;AN000; now bx points to maxs
 23890 00001699 268A0F                  	mov	cl,[es:bx]		;AN000;

 23892                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; at least one switch ?
 23893                                  	;jz	short _$P_SW_Not_Found 	;AN000;
 23894                                  	; 07/07/2023

 23896                                  
 23897 000016A0 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000; now bx points to 1st CONTROL address
 23898                                  
 23899                                  _$P_SW_Mgr_Loop: 			;AN000;

 23908                                  					;AN000; else bx points to the next CONTROL

 24189                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24190                                  ;
 24191                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24192                                  ;
 24193                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24194                                  ;	    AL = type
 24195                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)

 24599                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24600                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24601                                  ;
 24602                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24603                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24604                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24605                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24606                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24607                                  ;
 24608                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24609                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24610                                  ;
 24611                                  ; Output:    None
 24612                                  ;
 24613                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24614                                  ;
 24615                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24616                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24617                                  
 24618                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24619                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24620                                  
 24621                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24622                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 24623                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24624 0000197E 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24625 0000197F 2E800E[F814]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24626 00001985 2E8026[F814]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24627                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 24628 0000198B 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24629 0000198E 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24630 00001990 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24631                                  
 24632 00001992 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24633 00001994 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24634                                  
 24635 00001996 2E800E[F814]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24636                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24637 0000199C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24638                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24639 0000199D E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24640 000019A0 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24641 000019A1 C3                      	retn
 24642                                  
 24643                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24644                                  
 24645                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24646                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 24647                                  
 24648                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24649                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 24650 000019A2 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24651 000019A3 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24652 000019A4 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24653 000019A5 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24654 000019A6 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 24655 000019A8 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 24656 000019AA 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 24657                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 24658 000019AB 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 24659 000019AE 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 24660 000019B0 743C                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 24661                                  
 24662 000019B2 E8DD00                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 24663 000019B5 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 24664                                  
 24665 000019B7 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 24666 000019B9 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 24667                                  
 24668                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24669                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 24670                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 24671                                  %if 0
 24672                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 24673                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24674                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24675                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24676                                  
 24677                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 24678                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 24679                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 24680                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24681                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?

 24894                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24895                                  ;
 24896                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24897                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24898                                  ;
 24899                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24900                                  ;
 24901                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24902                                  ;
 24903                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24904                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24905                                  
 24906                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24907                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24908 00001A80 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24909 00001A81 2EF606[F814]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24910 00001A87 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24911                                  
 24912 00001A89 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24913 00001A8A C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24914                                  
 24915                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24916 00001A8B 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24917 00001A8C 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24918                                  
 24919 00001A8E F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24920 00001A8F C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24921                                  
 24922                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24923 00001A90 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24924 00001A91 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25058                                  ; Function:  Compare two string
 25059                                  ;

 25067                                  ;

 25444                                  _$P_Skip_Delim:

 25446 00001C6B AC                      	lodsb				;AN000;
 25447 00001C6C E81E00                  	call	_$P_Chk_EOL		;AN000; is it EOL character ?

 25449

 25452

 25455

 25457                                  	;jz	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; no switch, no keyword (tm08)
 25458                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25459                                  	; cf=0
 25460 00001C84 7505                    	jnz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 25461 00001C86 C3                      	retn
 25462                                  
 25463                                  	;dec	si			;AN000; backup si for next call (tm08)
 25464                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; else exit w/ CY off

 25467                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25468                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit

 25488                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25489                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 25490                                  ;
 25491                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 25492                                  ;
 25493                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25494                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25495                                  ;
 25496                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 25497                                  ;**********************************************************************
 25498                                  
 25499                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 25500 00001C8D 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25501 00001C8E 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25502 00001C8F 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 25503 00001C91 742C                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25504 00001C93 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 25505 00001C95 7428                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25506                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 25507 00001C97 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 25508 00001C99 7424                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25509                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 25510 00001C9B 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 25511                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 25512 00001CA0 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25513 00001CA2 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 25514 00001CA4 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 25515                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25516 00001CA8 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 25517                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25518 00001CAB 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; *
 25519 00001CAD 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 25520 00001CB1 740B                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 25521                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25522                                  	;;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 25523                                  	;xor	ch,ch ; *
 25524 00001CB3 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; 
 25525                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 25526 00001CB6 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25527 00001CB7 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 25528 00001CBA 7403                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25529 00001CBC E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 25530                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25531                                  	; cx=0
 25532                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 25533                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 25534                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25535 00001CBE 41                      	inc	cx  ; zf=0  (cx=1) ; *
 25536                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 25537 00001CBF 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25538 00001CC0 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25539 00001CC1 C3                      	retn

 25541                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25542                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25543                                  ;
 25544                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25545                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25546                                  ;	    blanks.
 25547                                  ;
 25548                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25549                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25550                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25551                                  ;
 25552                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25553                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25554                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25555                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25556                                  
 25557                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25558                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 25559                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 25560                                  
 25561                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 25562 00001CC2 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25563 00001CC3 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25564 00001CC4 2EC606[F214]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 25565                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 25566                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 25567 00001CCA 2E8026[F814]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 25568 00001CD0 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 25569 00001CD2 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25570                                  
 25571 00001CD4 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 25572 00001CD6 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25573                                  
 25574 00001CD8 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 25575 00001CDA 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25576                                  
 25577                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 25578                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 25579                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25580                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 25581                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 25582                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 25583                                  %if 0
 25584                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25585                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 25586                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 25587                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25588                                  
 25589                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 25590                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25591                                  
 25592                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 25593                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 25594                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 25595                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25596                                  %endif
 25597                                  
 25598                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 25599 00001CDC 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 25600                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 25601 00001CE1 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25602                                  
 25603                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 25604 00001CE3 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 25605                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 25606 00001CE5 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 25607                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25608                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 25609                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 25610                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25611 00001CE9 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 25612                                  
 25613 00001CEB BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 25614                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 25615 00001CEE 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25616 00001CEF 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 25617 00001CF2 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25618                                  
 25619 00001CF4 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 25620                                  
 25621                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 25622                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 25623                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25624                                  	; cx=0 here
 25625 00001CF6 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 25626                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 25627                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 25628 00001CF7 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25629 00001CF8 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25630 00001CF9 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25631                                  
 25632                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 25633 00001CFA 2EA2[F214]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 25634 00001CFE 2EF606[F814]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 25635 00001D04 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 25636                                  
 25637 00001D06 2E800E[F814]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 25638                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 25639                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 25640 00001D0C 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 25641 00001D0E EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25642                                  
 25643                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25644                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25645                                  ;
 25646                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25647                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25648                                  ;
 25649                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25650                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25651                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25652                                  ;
 25653                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25654                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25655                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25656                                  
 25657                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25658                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25659                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25660                                  ;
 25661                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25662                                  
 25663                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25664                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25665                                  
 25666                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25667                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25668                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25669                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25670 00001D10 BD[0115]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25671                                  
 25672                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25673 00001D13 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25674 00001D15 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25675                                  
 25676                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25677 00001D17 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25678 00001D19 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25679                                  
 25680 00001D1B F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25681                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25682                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25683 00001D1C C3                      	retn
 25684                                  
 25685                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25686                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25687                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25688                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25689                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25690                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25691                                  
 25692                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25693                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25694 00001D1D 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25695 00001D1F 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25696                                  
 25697 00001D21 2E800E[F814]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25698                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25699                                  
 25700                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25701                                  	; cf=0
 25702                                  	;retn
 25703                                  
 25704                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25705                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25706                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25707 00001D27 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25708                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25709                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25710 00001D28 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25711                                  
 25712                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25713                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25714                                  ;
 25715                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25716                                  ;
 25717                                  ;  Input:
 25718                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25719                                  ;
 25720                                  ;  Output:
 25721                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25722                                  ;
 25723                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25724                                  ;
 25725                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25726                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25727                                  
 25728                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25729 00001D29 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25730 00001D2A 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25731 00001D2B 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25732                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25733                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25734                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25735 00001D2C 2E8B36[F514]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 25736 00001D31 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25737 00001D33 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25738 00001D35 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25739 00001D36 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25740 00001D37 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25741 00001D38 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25742 00001D39 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25743 00001D3A 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25744 00001D3B 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25745                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 25746                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25747 00001D3C 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 25748 00001D3E B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25749 00001D41 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25750                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25751 00001D43 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25752 00001D45 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25753 00001D47 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25754 00001D48 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25755 00001D49 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25756 00001D4A 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25757 00001D4B 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25758 00001D4C 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25759 00001D4D 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25760 00001D4E 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25761                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25762 00001D50 2E8936[F314]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25763 00001D55 2E891E[F514]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25764                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25765                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25766                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25767                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25768 00001D5A 2EC536[F314]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25769                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25770 00001D5F 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25771 00001D62 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25772 00001D64 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25773 00001D66 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25774 00001D68 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25775 00001D6B 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25776 00001D6D F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25777 00001D6E EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25778                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25779 00001D70 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25780 00001D71 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25781                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25782 00001D72 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25783                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25784                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25785                                  	; cf=0
 25786                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25787                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25788 00001D74 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25789 00001D75 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25790 00001D76 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25791 00001D77 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26359                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26360                                  ;
 26361                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26362                                  ;
 26363                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26364                                  ;
 26365                                  ;   Modification log:
 26366                                  ;
 26367                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26368                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26369                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26370                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26371                                  ;
 26372                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26373                                  ;
 26374                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26375                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26376                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26377                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26378                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26379                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26380                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26381                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26382                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26383                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26384                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26385                                  ;
 26386                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26387                                  
 26388                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26389                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26390                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26391                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26392                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26393                                  
 26394                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26395                                  
 26396                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26397                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26398                                  
 26399                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26400                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26401                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26402                                  
 26403                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26404                                  ;
 26405                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26406                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26407                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26408                                  ;	           line.
 26409                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26410                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26411                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26412                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26413                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26414                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26415                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26416                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26417                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26418                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26419                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26420                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26421                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26422                                  ;	           for details).
 26423                                  
 26424 00001F77 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 26425 00001F78 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 26426 00001F79 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 26427 00001F7B 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 26428 00001F7C 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26429 00001F8C 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26430 00001FAC 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 26431 00001FAD 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 26432 00001FAE 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 26433                                  
 26434                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26435                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26436                                  
 26437                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26438                                  
 26439                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26440

 26450                                  
 26451 00001FAF 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 26452 00001FB1 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26453 00001FB3 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26454 00001FB5 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26455 00001FB9 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26456                                  ; 30/12/2022

 26459                                  ;

 26461 00001FBF 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 26462 00001FC1 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)

 26556 00002022 A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 26557 00002025 E842F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26558 00002028 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26559                                  
 26560                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26561                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26562                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26563                                  ;
 26564                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26565                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26566                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26567                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26568                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26569                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26570                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26571                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26572                                  ;
 26573 0000202A 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26574 0000202B 8916[DD14]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 26575 0000202F 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 26576                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG

 26582 00002038 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx

 26584                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 26585                                  	;call    TempCDS

 26591                                   
 26592 0000203C 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 26593 0000203E 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 26594                                  
 26595 00002040 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26596 00002042 2E8B0E[5603]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 26597 00002047 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 26598                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh

 26601 0000204C 9C                      	pushf
 26602                                  
 26603                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 26604                                  
 26605 0000204D 50                      	push	ax
 26606 0000204E 57                      	push	di
 26607 0000204F 51                      	push	cx
 26608 00002050 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 26609 00002052 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 26610 00002054 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 26611 00002056 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 26612 00002058 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 26613                                  
 26614                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 26615                                  
 26616 0000205A 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 26617                                  
 26618                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 26619                                  
 26620                                  puteol:
 26621 0000205B B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 26622 0000205D AA                      	stosb
 26623 0000205E B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 26624 00002060 AA                      	stosb
 26625 00002061 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 26626                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26627                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 26628                                  
 26629                                  	; 11/12/2022

 26632 00002064 1F                      	pop	ds
 26633                                  
 26634 00002065 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 26635                                  
 26636 00002069 59                      	pop	cx
 26637 0000206A 5F                      	pop	di
 26638 0000206B 58                      	pop	ax
 26639                                  
 26640                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26641                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26642                                  	;push	cs
 26643                                  	;pop	ds

 26645 0000206C 50                      	push	ax
 26646                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE

 26648 0000206F CD21                    	int	21h
 26649 00002071 58                      	pop	ax
 26650 00002072 9D                      	popf
 26651 00002073 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 26652 00002075 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax

 26654                                  conferr:

 26676                                  
 26677                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26678 00002089 FF36[A302]              	push	word [CONFBOT]

 26680                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 26681 0000208D 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 26682                                  
 26683 0000208E 8B36[5803]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 26684 00002092 8936[5603]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 26685 00002096 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0

 26696                                  getcom:

 26698                                  	; ds = cs
 26699 000020A6 E84E16                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 26700 000020A9 E8EB08                  	call	getchr
 26701                                  conflp: 
 26702 000020AC 72F7                    	jc	short endconv
 26703                                  
 26704 000020AE FF06[AF02]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 26705                                  
 26706 000020B2 C606[E114]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26707 000020B7 C606[E414]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.

 26709 000020BE 7449                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 26710                                  
 26711                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26712                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 26713                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26714                                  ;%if 0
 26715                                  
 26716                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26717                                  
 26718                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26719                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26720                                  
 26721 000020C0 A2[DF14]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26722                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26723 000020C3 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26724 000020C5 803E[E014]00                    cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26725 000020CA 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26726                                  
 26727 000020CC 50                              push    ax                      ;
 26728 000020CD E8C708                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26729 000020D0 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26730 000020D2 E8C208                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26731 000020D5 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26732 000020D7 A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26733 000020DA 58                              pop     ax
 26734                                  ;
 26735                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26736                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26737                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26738                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26739                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26740                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26741                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26742                                  ;   spot.
 26743                                  ;
 26744                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26745                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26746                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26747                                  ;   retrieved.
 26748                                  ;
 26749 000020DB 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26750 000020E0 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 26751                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26752 000020E2 F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26753 000020E7 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26754 000020E9 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26755 000020EE 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 26756                                  final:                                  ;
 26757 000020F0 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26758                                  not_final:                              ;
 26759                                  ;endif
 26760                                  
 26761                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26762                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26763                                  
 26764 000020F3 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26765 000020F5 E89F08                  	call	getchr
 26766 000020F8 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26767                                  
 26768 000020FA 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26769                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26770                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26771 000020FF 73A4                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26772 00002101 E95F08                  	jmp	badop
 26773                                  	
 26774                                  coff:	
 26775                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26776                                  	; ds = cs
 26777                                  	;push	cs
