 26782                                  blank_line:
 26783 00002109 E88B08                  	call	getchr
 26784 0000210C EB9E                    	jmp	short conflp
 26785                                  
 26786                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26787                                  ; 11/12/2022
 26788                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 26789                                  ;coff_p:
 26790                                  	;push	cs
 26791                                  	;pop	ds
 26792                                  
 26793                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26794                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26795                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26796                                  ;install= command.
 26797                                  
 26798                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26799                                  ;install command
 26800                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26801                                  
 26802                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26803                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26804                                  tryi:
 26805 0000210E 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 26806 00002113 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 26807 00002115 E97F01                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 26808                                  not_init_pass:
 26809 00002118 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 26810                                          ; 11/12/2022
 26811                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 26812 0000211D 74E5                    	je	short coff
 26813                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26814                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26815                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 26816                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 26817                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 26818                                  					; and before install= commands
 26819                                  					; are processed
 26820                                  
 26821 0000211F 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 26822 00002124 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 26823 00002126 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 26824                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26825                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 26826 00002129 74D9                    	je	short coff
 26827                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26828                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26829                                  
 26830                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 26831                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 26832                                          
 26833 0000212B 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 26834                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26835 0000212E 7507                    	jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 26836                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26837                                  	;jne	short tryb	
 26838                                  	
 26839                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 26840 00002130 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26841                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 26842 00002135 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 26843                                  
 26844                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26845                                  ; (SYSINIT:2448h)
 26846                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26847                                  ;%if 0
 26848                                  precheck_installhigh:
 26849 00002137 80FC57                  	cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 26850 0000213A 756B                    	jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 26851                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26852 0000213C 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26853 00002141 EBC1                    	jmp	short coff
 26854                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26855                                  
 26856                                  multi_try_i:
 26857 00002143 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 26858                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 26859 00002146 750A                    	jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 26860                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26861                                  	;jne	short multi_pass_filter
 26862                                  
 26863                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26864                                  ;%if 1 
 26865                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26866                                  ;%if 0
 26867                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26868 00002148 E8FC1F                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26869 0000214B 7241                    	jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26870                                  ;endif
 26871                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26872                                  
 26873 0000214D E899EF                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26874 00002150 EBB2                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 26875                                  
 26876                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26877                                  ; (SYSINIT:2463h)
 26878                                  ;%if 1
 26879                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26880                                  ;%if 0
 26881                                  
 26882                                  multi_try_n:
 26883 00002152 80FC57                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 26884 00002155 7537                            jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 26885                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26886 00002157 E8ED1F                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26887 0000215A 7232                            jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26888                                  ;endif
 26889                                  
 26890                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 26891                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 26892                                  
 26893 0000215C B80058                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 26894 0000215F CD21                    	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 26895 00002161 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 26896 00002163 53                              push    bx                      ; save for the return
 26897                                  
 26898 00002164 81CB8000                        or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 26899 00002168 B80158                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 26900 0000216B CD21                    	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 26901                                  
 26902 0000216D B80258                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26903 00002170 CD21                            int     21h                     ; get link state
 26904 00002172 30E4                            xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26905 00002174 50                              push    ax                      ; save for return
 26906                                  
 26907 00002175 B80358                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26908 00002178 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 26909 0000217B CD21                    	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26910                                  
 26911 0000217D E869EF                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26912                                  
 26913 00002180 B80358                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26914 00002183 5B                              pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26915 00002184 CD21                            int     21h
 26916 00002186 5B                              pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26917 00002187 B80158                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26918 0000218A CD21                            int     21h
 26919                                  
 26920                                  	;jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 26921                                  	; 01/01/2023
 26922 0000218C EBA7                    	jmp	short multi_pass_coff2
 26923                                  
 26924                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26925                                  
 26926                                  multi_pass_filter:
 26927 0000218E 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 26928 00002191 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26929 00002193 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 26930 00002196 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26931 00002198 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 26932 0000219B 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 26933                                  
 26934                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 26935 0000219D FF0E[5A03]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 26936 000021A1 FF06[5603]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 26937                                  
 26938                                  multi_pass_coff:
 26939                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26940                                  	;jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.
 26941                                  	; 01/01/2023
 26942 000021A5 EB8E                    	jmp	short multi_pass_coff2

 26944                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26945                                  ; buffer command
 26946                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26947                                  
 26948                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26949                                  ;									      *
 26950                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26951                                  ;									      *
 26952                                  ; input :								      *
 26953                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26954                                  ; output:								      *
 26955                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26956                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26957                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26958                                  ;									      *
 26959                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26960                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26961                                  ; logic:								      *
 26962                                  ; {									      *
 26963                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26964                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26965                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26966                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26967                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26968                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26969                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26970                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26971                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26972                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26973                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26974                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26975                                  ;	};								      *
 26976                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26977                                  ; };									      *
 26978                                  ;									      *
 26979                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26980                                  
 26981                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26982                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26983                                  tryb:
 26984 000021A7 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26985 000021AA 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 26986                                  
 26987                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26988                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)
 26989                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26990                                  ;%if 0
 26991                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26992 000021AC E8981F                  	call	query_user		; query the user if config_cmd
 26993 000021AF 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26994                                  ;endif
 26995                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26996                                  
 26997                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26998                                  	; 18/12/2022
 26999 000021B1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27000                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019

 27002                                  
 27003 000021B7 BF[781D]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 27004                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 27005                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27006                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27007                                  do7:
 27008 000021BA E88307                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27009 000021BD 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 27010                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 27011                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 27012                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27013                                  ;sr7:
 27014                                  	;jmp	coff
 27015                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27016 000021BF E9AA06                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27017                                  if7:
 27018 000021C2 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 27019 000021C5 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 27020                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 27021 000021C7 813E[C31D][B81D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 27022                                  	;jne	short if11
 27023                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27024 000021CD 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 27025                                  
 27026                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 27027                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 27028                                  if11:
 27029                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 27030 000021CF A1[C51D]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]
 27031 000021D2 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1
 27032 000021D5 7505                    	jne	short if13
 27033                                  
 27034 000021D7 A3[BB1D]                	mov	[p_buffers],ax
 27035                                  	;jmp	short en11
 27036                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27037 000021DA EBDE                    	jmp	short do7
 27038                                  if13:
 27039 000021DC A3[BD1D]                	mov	[p_h_buffers],ax

 27042                                  en7:
 27043 000021E1 833E[BB1D]63            	cmp	word [p_buffers],99
 27044 000021E6 760B                    	jbe	short if18
 27045                                  
 27046                                  ;	cmp	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; M016
 27047                                  ;	jne	short if18
 27048                                  
 27049 000021E8 E88407                  	call	badparm_p
 27050 000021EB C706[BD1D]0000          	mov	word [p_h_buffers],0
 27051 000021F1 EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 27052                                  if18:
 27053 000021F3 A1[BB1D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.
 27054 000021F6 A3[9902]                	mov	[buffers],ax	; now,let's set it really.
 27055

 27066                                  	; 03/01/2023

 27068 00002205 E9FCFE                  	jmp	coff

 27070                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27071                                  ; break command
 27072                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27073                                  
 27074                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27075                                  ;									    *
 27076                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27077                                  ;									    *
 27078                                  ; input :								    *
 27079                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27080                                  ; output:								    *
 27081                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27082                                  ;									    *
 27083                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27084                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27085                                  ; logic:								    *
 27086                                  ; {									    *
 27087                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27088                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27089                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27090                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27091                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27092                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 27093                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 27094                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27095                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 27096                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 27097                                  ;	};								    *
 27098                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 27099                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 27100                                  ; };									    *
 27101                                  ;									    *
 27102                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27103                                  
 27104                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27105                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 27106                                  tryc:
 27107 00002208 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 27108 0000220B 7539                    	jne	short trym
 27109                                  
 27110                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27111                                  ; (SYSINIT:2527h)
 27112                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27113                                  ;%if 0
 27114                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27115 0000220D E8371F                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27116 00002210 7234                    	jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27117                                  ;endif
 27118                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27119                                  
 27120 00002212 BF[C91D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 27121 00002215 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27122                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27123                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27124                                  do22:
 27125 00002217 E82607                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27126 0000221A 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 27127                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 27128                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 27129                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27130                                  ;sr22:
 27131                                  	;jmp	coff
 27132                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27133 0000221C E94D06                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27134                                  if22:
 27135 0000221F 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 27136 00002222 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 27137                                  
 27138                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 27139 00002224 803E[C21D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 27140 00002229 7507                    	jne	short if26
 27141                                  
 27142 0000222B C606[EE1D]01            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],1	; turn it on
 27143                                  	;jmp	short en26
 27144                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27145 00002230 EBE5                    	jmp	short do22

 27147 00002232 C606[EE1D]00            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],0	; turn it off
 27148                                  en26:

 27150                                  en22:
 27151 00002239 B433                    	mov	ah,SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING ; if we don't have any parse error.

 27154 00002241 CD21                    	int	21h
 27155                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27156                                  	;jmp	short sr22
 27157                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27158                                  sr22:
 27159 00002243 E9BEFE                  	jmp	coff

 27725                                  skip_pass_limit:
 27726                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 27727                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 27728                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 27729                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 27730                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 27731                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
 27732                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.

 28659                                  
 28660                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28661                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28662                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28663                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28664                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28665                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28666                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28667                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28668                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28669                                  
 28670                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28671                                  ;									  *
 28672                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28673                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28674                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28675                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28676                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28677                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28678                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28679                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28680                                  ; input :								  *
 28681                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28682                                  ; output:								  *
 28683                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28684                                  ;									  *
 28685                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28686                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *

 28689                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28690                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28691                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28692                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28693                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28694                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28695                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28696                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28697                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28698                                  ;	     }								  *
 28699                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28700                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 28701                                  ;	};								  *
 28702                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28703                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28704                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *

 29181                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------

 29183                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29184                                  ;								       *
 29185                                  ; function: parse the option switches specified.		       *
 29186                                  ; note - this command is intended for the future use also.	       *
 29187                                  ; when we need to set system data flag,use this command.	       *
 29188                                  ;								       *
 29189                                  ; input :							       *
 29190                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.			       *
 29191                                  ; output:							       *
 29192                                  ;	p_swit_k set if /k option chosen.			       *
 29193                                  ;								       *
 29194                                  ; subroutines to be called:					       *
 29195                                  ;	sysinit_parse						       *
 29196                                  ; logic:							       *
 29197                                  ; {								       *
 29198                                  ;	set di points to swit_parms;  /*parse control definition*/     *
 29199                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 					       *
 29200                                  ;	while (end of command line)				       *
 29201                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;					       *
 29202                                  ;	  if (no error) then					       *
 29203                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == swit_k) then	       *
 29204                                  ;		    p_swit_k = 1				       *
 29205                                  ;	       endif						       *
 29206                                  ;	  else {show error message;error exit}			       *
 29207                                  ;	};							       *
 29208                                  ; };								       *
 29209                                  ;								       *
 29210                                  ;***********************************************************************

 29445                                  sysinit_parse:
 29446                                  
 29447                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29448                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 29449                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 29450                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 29451                                  ;
 29452                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 29453                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 29454                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29455                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29456                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29457                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29458                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29459                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29460                                  ;	 procedure.
 29461                                  ;	ax - exit code
 29462                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 29463                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 29464                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 29465                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 29466                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29467                                  
 29468                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29469                                  	; (SYSINIT:2D78h)

 29471                                  	; 24/10/2022

 29794                                  ;
 29795                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29796                                  ;
 29797                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29798                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29799                                  ;
 29800                                  ;	Output : none
 29801                                  ;
 29802                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29803                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29804                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29805                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29806                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29807                                  ;
 29808                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29809

 29811                                  	; 11/12/2022

 29815                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29816 00002A03 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29817 00002A06 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29818                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29819                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29820                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie

 29827                                  lim_set:
 29828                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 29836                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29837                                  ;
 29838                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29839                                  ;
 29840                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29841                                  ;	Output : none
 29842                                  ;
 29843                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29844                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29845                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29846                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29847                                  ;
 29848                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29849                                  
 29850                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29851                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29852 00002A12 1E                      	push	ds
 29853 00002A13 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29854 00002A16 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29855 00002A18 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29856 00002A1C 2E891E[D11F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29857 00002A21 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29858 00002A23 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29859 00002A25 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29860 00002A28 2EC606[D01F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29861 00002A2E 1F                      	pop	ds
 29862                                  ;limx:
 29863 00002A2F C3                      	retn
 29864                                  
 29865                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29866                                  ;
 29867                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29868                                  ;
 29869                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29870                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29871                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29872                                  ;
 29873                                  ;	Output : none
 29874                                  ;
 29875                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29876                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29877                                  ;
 29878                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29879                                  
 29880                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29881                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29882                                  	; ds = cs

 29885                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29886                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29887 00002A35 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29888                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29889 00002A37 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29890 00002A3A 8826[D01F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29891                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29892                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29893 00002A3E 1E                      	push	ds
 29894                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29895 00002A3F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29896 00002A41 2EA1[D11F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29897 00002A45 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29898 00002A48 1F                      	pop	ds
 29899                                  timx:
 29900 00002A49 C3                      	retn

 29953                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 29956                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29957                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29958                                  
 29959                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29960                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29961                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29962                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29963                                  
 29964                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29965                                  ;
 29966                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29967                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29968                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29969                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29970                                  ;
 29971                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29972                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29973                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29974                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29975                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29976                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29977                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29978                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29979                                  ; available during the load.
 29980                                  ;
 29981                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29982                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29983                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29984                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29985                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29986                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29987                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29988                                  ;
 29989                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29990                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29991                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29992                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29993                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29994                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29995                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29996                                  ;
 29997                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29998                                  
 29999                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30000                                  
 30001                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30002                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30003                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30004                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30005                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30006                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30007                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30008                                  
 30009                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30010                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30011                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30012                                  
 30013                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30014                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30015                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30016                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30017                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30018                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30019                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30020                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30021                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30022                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30023                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30024                                  
 30025                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30026                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30027                                  
 30028                                  InitVar:
 30029                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30030                                  	; ds = cs
 30031                                  
 30032                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30033                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30034                                  	;push	ax
 30035                                  	;push	cx
 30036                                  	;push	di
 30037 00002A74 06                      	push	es
 30038                                  
 30039                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30040 00002A75 0E                      	push	cs
 30041 00002A76 07                      	pop	es
 30042                                  
 30043 00002A77 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30044                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30045                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30046                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30047                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30048                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30049                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30050                                  
 30051                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30052                                  	; ds = cs
 30053 00002A79 A2[781F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30054 00002A7C A2[771F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30055 00002A7F A3[791F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30056 00002A82 C606[7B1F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30057                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30058 00002A87 A2[AE1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30059

 30063 00002A8E BF[7C1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,

 30070 00002A98 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30071

 30073

 30075 00002A9A 07                      	pop	es

 30082                                  
 30083                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30084                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30085                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30086                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30087                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30088                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30089                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30090                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30091                                  
 30092                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30093                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30094                                  FixMem:
 30095                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30096                                  	;push	ax
 30097                                  	;push	bx
 30098                                  	;push	cx
 30099                                  	;push	dx
 30100 00002A9C 06                      	push	es
 30101                                  
 30102 00002A9D E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30103                                  
 30104 00002AA0 E80C02                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30105 00002AA3 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30106                                  
 30107 00002AA5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30108                                  
 30109                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30110                                  
 30111 00002AA7 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30112 00002AA9 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30113 00002AAB 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30114                                  
 30115                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30116                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30117                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30118                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30119                                  
 30120 00002AAC 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30121 00002AB0 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30122 00002AB5 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30123 00002AB7 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30124                                  
 30125                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30126                                  
 30127 00002AB9 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30128 00002ABE 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30129 00002AC0 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30130                                  
 30131 00002AC4 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30132                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30133                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30134 00002AC9 43                      	inc	bx
 30135 00002ACA 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30136                                  
 30137                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30138                                  
 30139 00002ACF 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30140 00002AD1 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30141                                  
 30142 00002AD6 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30143 00002AD8 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30144 00002ADD 43                      	inc	bx
 30145 00002ADE 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30146                                  
 30147                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30148 00002AE0 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30149 00002AE2 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30150                                  fmX:	
 30151 00002AE4 E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30152                                  
 30153 00002AE7 07                      	pop	es
 30154                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30155                                  	;pop	dx
 30156                                  	;pop	cx
 30157                                  	;pop	bx
 30158                                  	;pop	ax
 30159                                  
 30160 00002AE8 C3                      	retn
 30161                                  
 30162                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30163                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30164                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30165                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30166                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30167                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30168                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30169                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30170                                  
 30171                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30172                                  fm_link:
 30173 00002AE9 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30174 00002AEC CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30175                                  
 30176                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30177                                  	;
 30178                                  	;push	es
 30179                                  	;push	cs
 30180                                  	;pop	es
 30181                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30182                                  	;pop	es
 30183                                  	
 30184                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30185                                  	; ds = cs
 30186                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al

 30226                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30227                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30228                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30229                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30230                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30231                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30232                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30233                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30234                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30235                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30236                                  ;
 30237                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30238                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30239                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30240                                  ;
 30241                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30242                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30243                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30244                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30245                                  ;
 30246                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30247                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30248                                  ;
 30249                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30250                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30251                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30252                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30253                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30254                                  ;     lh
 30255                                  ;     /l
 30256                                  ;     1
 30257                                  ;     1000
 30258                                  ;     2
 30259                                  ;     print
 30260                                  ;     /d
 30261                                  ;     :lpt2
 30262                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30263                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30264                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30265                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30266                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30267                                  ; for:
 30268                                  ;    Each /L
 30269                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30270                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30271                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30272                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30273                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30274                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30275                                  
 30276                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30277                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30278                                  
 30279                                  ParseVar:
 30280                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30281                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30282                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30283 00002B06 1E                      	push	ds
 30284 00002B07 06                      	push	es
 30285                                  
 30286 00002B08 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30287 00002B09 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30288 00002B0A FC                      	cld
 30289                                  
 30290                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30291                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30292                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30293                                  
 30294 00002B0B AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30295 00002B0C E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 30296 00002B0F 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30297                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30298 00002B11 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30299 00002B13 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30300                                  
 30301 00002B15 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30302 00002B16 F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30303 00002B17 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30304                                  
 30305 00002B19 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30306                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30307 00002B1A 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 30308                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30309 00002B1C 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30310 00002B1E 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 30311                                  
 30312                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30313 00002B20 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30314                                  
 30315                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30316                                  	;
 30317                                  	;push	es
 30318                                  	;push	cs
 30319                                  	;pop	es
 30320                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30321                                  	;pop	es
 30322                                  
 30323 00002B25 2EC606[781F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30324                                  
 30325 00002B2B EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30326                                  
 30327                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30328 00002B2D 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 30329 00002B2F 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 30330                                  
 30331                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30332 00002B31 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30333                                  
 30334 00002B36 E80E00                  	call	parseL
 30335 00002B39 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30336                                  
 30337 00002B3B 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30338 00002B3C EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30339                                  
 30340                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30341 00002B3E B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30342 00002B41 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 30343 00002B42 4E                      	dec	si
 30344 00002B43 F9                      	stc
 30345                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30346 00002B44 07                      	pop	es
 30347 00002B45 1F                      	pop	ds
 30348                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30349                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30350 00002B46 C3                      	retn
 30351                                  
 30352                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30353                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30354                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30355                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30356                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30357                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30358                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30359                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30360                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30361                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30362                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 30363                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30364                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30365                                  
 30366                                  parseL:
 30367 00002B47 AC                      	lodsb
 30368 00002B48 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30369 00002B4A 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30370                                  
 30371                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30372                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30373                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30374                                  
 30375 00002B4C E8E700                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30376 00002B4F 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30377 00002B51 E8A901                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30378                                  
 30379 00002B54 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30380 00002B56 E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30381 00002B59 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30382                                  
 30383                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30384 00002B5B 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30385                                  
 30386 00002B60 AC                      	lodsb
 30387 00002B61 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30388 00002B63 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30389                                  
 30390 00002B65 E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30391 00002B68 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30392                                  
 30393 00002B6A E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30394 00002B6D 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30395                                  
 30396                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30397 00002B6F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30398 00002B71 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30399                                  
 30400 00002B73 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30401 00002B75 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30402                                  
 30403                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30404                                  
 30405 00002B77 E8BC00                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30406 00002B7A 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30407                                  
 30408 00002B7C E82201                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30409                                  
 30410 00002B7F E87200                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30411                                  
 30412                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30413 00002B82 2EFE06[AE1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30414                                  
 30415 00002B87 AC                      	lodsb
 30416 00002B88 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30417 00002B8A 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 30418                                  
 30419 00002B8C E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 30420 00002B8F 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 30421                                  
 30422 00002B91 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 30423 00002B94 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30424                                  
 30425                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30426 00002B96 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 30427 00002B98 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 30428                                  plE1:	
 30429                                  	;mov	ax,1
 30430 00002B9A B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 30431 00002B9D 4E                      	dec	si
 30432 00002B9E F9                      	stc
 30433 00002B9F C3                      	retn
 30434                                  
 30435                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 30436 00002BA0 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 30437                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30438                                  	; cf=1
 30439                                  	;stc
 30440 00002BA3 C3                      	retn
 30441                                  plSwX:	
 30442 00002BA4 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 30443                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 30444                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 30445                                  	; cf=0
 30446                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 30447 00002BA5 C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 30448

 30474                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30475                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30476                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30477                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30478                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30479                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30480                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30481                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30482                                  
 30483                                  isEOL:
 30484 00002BA6 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 30485 00002BA8 7406                    	je	short ieX
 30486 00002BAA 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 30487 00002BAC 7402                    	je	short ieX
 30488 00002BAE 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 30489                                  ieX:	
 30490 00002BB0 C3                      	retn
 30491                                  
 30492                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30493                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 30494                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30495                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30496                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 30497                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30498                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30499                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30500                                  
 30501                                  isWhite:
 30502 00002BB1 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 30503 00002BB3 7406                    	je	short iwX

 30505 00002BB7 7402                    	je	short iwX
 30506 00002BB9 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 30507                                  iwX:	
 30508 00002BBB C3                      	retn

 30561                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30562                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 30563                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 30564                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 30565                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 30566                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30567                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 30568                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30569                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 30570                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30571                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30572                                  
 30573                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30574                                  stowUMB:

 30576 00002BD1 7202                    	jb	short su10

 30579                                  su10:

 30581                                  	;push	bx

 30584                                  	;push	ds

 30586                                  	;push	cs

 30598                                  
 30599                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 30600                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 30601                                  	;jne	short su20
 30602                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 30603                                  su20:

 30620                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.

 30637                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 30638                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30639                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 30640                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30641                                  ; ERROR:    None
