 30668                                  
 30669 00002BFF C3                      	retn
 30670                                  
 30671                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30672                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 30673                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 30674                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 30675                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 30676                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30677                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 30678                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 30679                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 30680                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 30681                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30682                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30683                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30684                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30685                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30686                                  
 30687                                  gnradix:
 30688 00002C00 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 30689                                  
 30690                                  toDigit:
 30691 00002C02 2E833E[002C]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 30692 00002C08 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 30693                                  
 30694                                  toDigit_hex:
 30695 00002C0A 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 30696 00002C0D 7209                    	jb	short td10
 30697 00002C0F 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 30698 00002C12 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 30699 00002C14 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 30700                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30701 00002C17 C3                      	retn
 30702                                  td10:	
 30703 00002C18 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 30704 00002C1B 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 30705 00002C1D 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 30706 00002C20 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 30707 00002C22 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 30708                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30709 00002C25 C3                      	retn
 30710                                  toDigit_dec:
 30711                                  td20:	
 30712 00002C26 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 30713                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 30714 00002C29 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 30715 00002C2B 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 30716 00002C2E 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 30717 00002C30 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 30718                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30719 00002C33 C3                      	retn
 30720                                  tdE:	
 30721 00002C34 F9                      	stc
 30722                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 30723 00002C35 C3                      	retn
 30724                                  
 30725                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30726                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 30727                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30728                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 30729                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 30730                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 30731                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 30732                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30733                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30734                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30735                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30736                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30737                                  
 30738                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30739                                  
 30740                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30741                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 30742                                  
 30743                                  GetXNum:
 30744                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 30745                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30746                                  	;push	bx
 30747 00002C36 51                      	push	cx ; *
 30748                                  	;push	ds
 30749                                  
 30750 00002C37 FC                      	cld
 30751 00002C38 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30752 00002C3A 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30753 00002C3C 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 30754 00002C3E 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 30755                                  
 30756 00002C40 2EC706[002C]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 30757                                  
 30758 00002C47 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 30759                                  	;call	toDigit
 30760 00002C4A E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 30761                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 30762                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30763 00002C4D 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 30764                                  
 30765 00002C4F 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 30766 00002C51 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 30767 00002C53 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 30768 00002C57 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 30769 00002C5A 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 30770 00002C5C 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 30771 00002C5F 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 30772                                  
 30773                                  gxn10:	
 30774 00002C61 2EC706[002C]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 30775 00002C68 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 30776 00002C69 46                      	inc	si
 30777                                  
 30778                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30779                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 30780                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 30781                                  ;        BX    = 0
 30782                                  ;        CH    = 0
 30783                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30784                                  
 30785                                  gxn20:	
 30786 00002C6A 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 30787 00002C6D 46                      	inc	si
 30788                                  
 30789 00002C6E E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 30790 00002C71 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 30791                                  
 30792 00002C73 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 30793 00002C76 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 30794                                  
 30795 00002C78 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 30796 00002C7A 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 30797                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 30798                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 30799 00002C7C 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 30800                                  gxnE:	
 30801                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 30802 00002C7E EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 30803                                  gxnQ:	
 30804 00002C80 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 30805 00002C81 F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 30806                                  gxnX:	
 30807                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30808                                  	;pop	ds
 30809 00002C82 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 30810                                  	;pop	bx
 30811 00002C83 C3                      	retn
 30812                                  
 30813                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30814                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 30815                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30816                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 30817                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 30818                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 30819                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 30820                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30821                                  
 30822                                  mul32:
 30823 00002C84 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30824 00002C85 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30825 00002C87 2EF726[002C]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30826 00002C8C 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 30827                                  
 30828 00002C8E 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30829 00002C90 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 30830                                  
 30831 00002C91 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 30832 00002C93 2EF726[002C]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 30833 00002C98 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 30834 00002C9A 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 30835 00002C9C 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 30836 00002C9E C3                      	retn
 30837                                  m32E:	
 30838 00002C9F 58                      	pop	ax
 30839 00002CA0 C3                      	retn
 30840                                  
 30841                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30842                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 30843                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30844                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 30845                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 30846                                  ; ERROR:   None
 30847                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 30848                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30849                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 30850                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 30851                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30852                                  
 30853                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30854                                  toPara:
 30855 00002CA1 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 30856                                  
 30857 00002CA2 B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 30858 00002CA4 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 30859 00002CA6 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 30860 00002CA7 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 30861 00002CA9 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 30862 00002CAB 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 30863                                  
 30864 00002CAD 59                      	pop	cx
 30865 00002CAE C3                      	retn
 30866                                  
 30867                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30868                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 30869                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30870                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 30871                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 30872                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 30873                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30874                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30875                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 30876                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 30877                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 30878                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 30879                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30880                                  
 30881                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30882                                  UmbHead:
 30883                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 30884                                  
 30885                                  	;push	si ; ?
 30886                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 30887                                  	;push	es
 30888                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 30889                                  
 30890                                  	; 09/04/2019
 30891                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 30892                                  
 30893 00002CAF B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 30894 00002CB1 CD21                    	int	21h
 30895                                  
 30896 00002CB3 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 30897                                  	
 30898                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30899 00002CB7 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 30900 00002CBA F5                      	cmc
 30901                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 30902 00002CBB C3                      	retn
 30903                                  
 30904                                  ; 01/01/2023
 30905                                  ;%if 0
 30906                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 30907                                  ;	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 30908                                  ;
 30909                                  ;	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 30910                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX
 30911                                  ;	; 12/12/2022
 30912                                  ;	retn
 30913                                  ;uhE:	
 30914                                  ;	stc
 30915                                  ;uhX:	
 30916                                  ;	;pop	bx ; *
 30917                                  ;	;pop	es
 30918                                  ;	;pop	ds ; ?
 30919                                  ;	;pop	si ; ?
 30920                                  ;	retn
 30921                                  ;%endif
 30922                                  
 30923                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30924                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 30925                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30926                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 30927                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 30928                                  ; USES:   Flags
 30929                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30930                                  
 30931                                  isSysMCB:
 30932                                  	;push	ax
 30933                                  
 30934                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 30935                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 30936                                  	;je	short ism10
 30937                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 30938                                  	;;je	short ism10
 30939                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 30940                                  	;jne	short ismX
 30941 00002CBC 26833E010008            	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 30942 00002CC2 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 30943                                  ism10:	
 30944                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 30945                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 30946 00002CC4 26813E08005343          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 30947                                  ismX:	
 30948                                  	;pop	ax
 30949 00002CCB C3                      	retn
 30950                                  
 30951                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30952                                  
 30953                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30954                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 30955                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30956                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 30957                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 30958                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 30959                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30960                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30961                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 30962                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 30963                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 30964                                  ;      ...
 30965                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 30966                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30967                                  
 30968                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30969                                  AddrToUmb:
 30970                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30971                                  	;push	cx
 30972                                  	;push	dx
 30973 00002CCC 06                      	push	es
 30974                                  
 30975 00002CCD 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 30976                                  
 30977 00002CCF E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 30978 00002CD2 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 30979                                  
 30980                                  	; 22/07/2023
 30981                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 30982 00002CD4 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 30983                                  
 30984                                  	; 22/07/2023
 30985                                  atu10:
 30986 00002CD6 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 30987                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 30988                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 30989                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 30990                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 30991                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 30992                                  
 30993                                  ;atu10:	
 30994                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 30995 00002CD8 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 30996 00002CDA 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 30997                                  
 30998 00002CDC E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 30999 00002CDF 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 31000                                  
 31001 00002CE1 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 31002                                  atu20:	
 31003                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31004                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 31005                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31006                                  	; ax = es
 31007                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31008 00002CE2 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31009 00002CE7 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 31010 00002CED 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 31011                                  
 31012                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 31013                                  
 31014                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31015                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 31016                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31017 00002CEF 40                      	inc	ax
 31018                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31019                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 31020 00002CF0 EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 31021                                  
 31022                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31023                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 31024                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 31025                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31026                                  
 31027                                  atu30:	
 31028                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31029                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 31030                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31031                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 31032 00002CF2 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 31033 00002CF4 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 31034                                  atuE:	
 31035 00002CF6 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 31036 00002CF8 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 31037                                  atuX:	
 31038 00002CF9 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 31039                                  	
 31040 00002CFB 07                      	pop	es	
 31041                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31042                                  	;pop	dx
 31043                                  	;pop	cx
 31044 00002CFC C3                      	retn
 31045                                  
 31046                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31047                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 31048                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 31049                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 31050                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 31051                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31052                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 31053                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 31054                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31055                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31056                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31057                                  
 31058                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31059                                  convUMB:
 31060 00002CFD 2E833E[002C]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31061 00002D03 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 31062 00002D05 E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 31063                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31064                                  	;jne	short cu10
 31065                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31066                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31067 00002D08 40                      	inc	ax
 31068 00002D09 7401                    	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31069 00002D0B 48                      	dec	ax
 31070                                  cu10:	
 31071 00002D0C C3                      	retn
 31072                                  
 31073                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31074                                  ;%if 0
 31075                                  ;
 31076                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31077                                  ;;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 31078                                  ;;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 31079                                  ;; of the usual HIGH_FIRST. See the code.
 31080                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31081                                  ;; ENTRY:  None
 31082                                  ;; EXIT:   None
 31083                                  ;; ERROR:  None
 31084                                  ;; USES:   Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 31085                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31086                                  ;
 31087                                  ;setUMBs:

 31089                                  ;	push	bx
 31090                                  ;	call	fm_link
 31091                                  ;	pop	bx
 31092                                  ;	pop	ax
 31093                                  ;	retn

 31096                                  
 31097                                  ; 18/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 31098                                  ; loadLow subroutine is not used anywhere of IO.SYS 6.22 (& 5.0)
 31099                                  %if 0
 31100                                  
 31101                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31102                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 31103                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31104                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 31105                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 31106                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 31107                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31108                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 31109                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31110                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 31111                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0. That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 31112                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 31113                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 31114                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31115                                  
 31116                                  loadLow:
 31117                                  	;push	ds
 31118                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 31119                                  	;pop	ds	
 31120                                  
 31121                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 31122                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 31123                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 31124                                  	jne	short ll10
 31125                                  
 31126                                  	stc
 31127                                  ll15:

 31532                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31533                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 31534                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 31535                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31536                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 31537                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to first MCB in UMB (_not_ the 8+SC MCB that heads it)
 31538                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (too high)
 31539                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 31540                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31541                                  
 31542                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31543                                  	; (SYSINIT:3344h)
 31544                                  findUMB:

 31552

 31554                                  
 31555 00002DD6 E8D6FE                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns first UMB segment in AX
 31556                                  	; 22/07/2023

 31559                                  
 31560                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31561                                  fu10:
 31562 00002DDB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; **
 31563                                  ; ---------------------------------------------

 31565                                  ;       DX - The UMB number they're looking for
 31566                                  ;       ES - The current MCB address

 31568                                  
 31569                                  ;fu10:

 31571 00002DDF 7417                    	je	short fuX	; searching for--so exit.
 31572

 31574 00002DE4 7501                    	jnz	short fu20
 31575

 31577                                  fu20:

 31604                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31605                                  ;*** BigFree - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 31606                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31607                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 31608                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to largest free MCB in UMB, AX returns its size
 31609                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (0 or too high)
 31610                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 31611                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31612                                  
 31613                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31614                                  BigFree:
 31615                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31616                                  	;push	bx
 31617 00002DFA 51                      	push	cx
 31618                                  
 31619 00002DFB E8D3FF                  	call	findUMB			; Returns with CF if err, else ES==MCB
 31620 00002DFE 723A                    	jc	short bfX		; (would be "jc bfE"; it just does stc)
 31621                                  
 31622 00002E00 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; Segment address of largest free MCB
 31623 00002E02 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; Size of largest free MCB
 31624                                  
 31625                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 31626                                  ; BF10--ES - Current MCB address
 31627                                  ;       BX - Address of largest free MCB so far
 31628                                  ;       CX - Size of largest free MCB so far
 31629                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 31630                                  
 31631                                  bf10:	
 31632 00002E04 E8B5FE                  	call	isSysMCB		; If we've left the MCB, we're done.
 31633 00002E07 7428                    	jz	short bf30
 31634                                  
 31635                                  	;call	isFreeMCB		; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 31636 00002E09 26830E010000            	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 31637 00002E0F 750C                    	jnz	short bf20
 31638                                  
 31639 00002E11 26A10300                	mov	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31640                                  	;cmp	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Compare sizes...
 31641 00002E15 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 31642                                  	;jg	short bf20		; Unless we're bigger,
 31643                                  	; 19/07/2023
 31644 00002E17 7D04                    	jge	short bf20
 31645                                  
 31646 00002E19 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Store this new element's address,
 31647                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; and its size.
 31648 00002E1B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 31649                                  
 31650                                  bf20:	
 31651                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31652                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end	; 'Z'
 31653                                  	; 19/07/2023
 31654                                  	;cmp	byte [es:0],'Z'
 31655 00002E1D 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 31656 00002E23 740C                    	jz	short bf30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB.

 31666

 31668 00002E33 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			; Return the size
 31669 00002E35 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 31670 00002E37 7501                    	jnz	short bfX		; (if size==0, there's nothing free)
 31671                                  bfE:

 31716                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31717                                  ;*** shrinkMCB - breaks an MCB into two pieces, the lowest one's size==AX
 31718                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31719                                  ; ENTRY:    AX == new size, ES:0 == current MCB
 31720                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB broken if carry clear
 31721                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if MCB isn't as large as AX+0x20 (not a useful split)
 31722                                  ; USES:     Flags
 31723                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31724                                  ; If the size of the to-be-split MCB isn't at least 0x20 bytes greater than
 31725                                  ; the specified new size, the split is useless; if it's only 0x10 bytes, that
 31726                                  ; 0x10 will be used to make a header that mentions a 0-byte free space, and
 31727                                  ; that just sucks up 0x10 bytes for nothing. So we make 0x20 bytes the
 31728                                  ; minimum for performing a split.
 31729                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31730                                  
 31731                                  MIN_SPLIT_SIZE	equ	20h
 31732                                  
 31733                                  	; 02/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31734                                  
 31735                                  shrinkMCB:
 31736                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx,es>
 31737                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31738                                  	;push	bx
 31739 00002E48 51                      	push	cx
 31740 00002E49 06                      	push	es
 31741                                  
 31742 00002E4A 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; Move things around... and
 31743                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31744                                  	;mov	ax,es			; save this one for later.
 31745                                  
 31746 00002E4C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31747                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31748 00002E51 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx 
 31749                                  
 31750 00002E53 83E820                  	sub	ax,MIN_SPLIT_SIZE ; 32
 31751                                  	;sub	cx,MIN_SPLIT_SIZE ; 32
 31752                                  	;;cmp	bx,cx			; {New size} vs {Current Size-20h}
 31753                                  	;ja	short smE		; if wanted_size > cur-20h, abort.
 31754                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31755                                  	;cmp	cx,bx
 31756                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31757 00002E56 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx
 31758 00002E58 7228                    	jb	short smE ; (*)
 31759                                  
 31760 00002E5A 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31761                                  	
 31762                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31763                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31764 00002E5F 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 31765                                  
 31766 00002E61 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx
 31767 00002E66 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],'M'
 31768                                  
 31769 00002E6C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx
 31770 00002E6E 40                      	inc	ax
 31771 00002E6F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; Move to new arena area
 31772                                  
 31773 00002E71 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 31774 00002E73 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 31775                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31776                                  	; ax > 0
 31777 00002E75 48                      	dec	ax			; And prepare the new size
 31778                                  
 31779                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31780 00002E76 2688160000              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl
 31781                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0 ; (**)
 31782 00002E7B 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax
 31783                                  	;mov	ax,'  ' ; 2020h
 31784                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+0],ax ; (**)
 31785                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+2],ax ; (**)
 31786                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+4],ax ; (**)
 31787                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+6],ax ; (**)
 31788                                  
 31789                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31790 00002E7F E8A401                  	call	freeMCB	; (**)
 31791                                  
 31792                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31793                                  	; cf=0
 31794                                  	;clc
 31795                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31796                                  	;jmp	short smX
 31797                                  smE:	
 31798                                  	; 18/12/2022
 31799                                  	; cf=1 (*)
 31800                                  	;stc
 31801                                  smX:	
 31802                                  	;popreg	<es,cx,bx>
 31803 00002E82 07                      	pop	es
 31804 00002E83 59                      	pop	cx
 31805                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31806                                  	;pop	bx
 31807 00002E84 C3                      	retn
 31808                                  
 31809                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31810                                  ;*** hideUMB? - hides as appropriate the UMB in CL
 31811                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31812                                  ; ENTRY:    CL should be to a valid UMB number, and AX to its address (findUMB)
 31813                                  ; EXIT:     None; UMB is hidden as necessary
 31814                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31815                                  ; USES:     Flags, AX, CX
 31816                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31817                                  ; PRIMARY LOGIC:
 31818                                  ;
 31819                                  ; If the UMB is specified in the DH/LH statement, then:
 31820                                  ;    If the largest free segment is too small (check specified size), then:
 31821                                  ;       Pretend it wasn't ever specified, and fall out of this IF.
 31822                                  ;    Else, if largest free segment is LARGER than specified size, then:
 31823                                  ;       If /S was given on the command-line, then:
 31824                                  ;          Break that element into two pieces
 31825                                  ;          Set a flag that we're shrinking
 31826                                  ;       Endif
 31827                                  ;    Endif
 31828                                  ; Endif
 31829                                  ; If the UMB is NOT specified (or was removed by the above):
 31830                                  ;    Hide all free elements in the UMB
 31831                                  ;    If the flag that we're shrinking was set, then:
 31832                                  ;       UN-hide the lower portion of the shrunken UMB
 31833                                  ;    ENDIF
 31834                                  ; ENDIF
 31835                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31836                                  
 31837                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31838                                  	; (SYSINIT:3426h)
 31839                                  _hideUMB_:
 31840                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31841                                  	; ds = cs
 31842                                  
 31843                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31844                                  	;push	bx
 31845                                  	;push	dx
 31846 00002E85 06                      	push	es
 31847                                  
 31848 00002E86 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 31849 00002E88 E8B1FF                  	call	isSpecified	; Returns ZF set if al's umb was NOT specified
 31850 00002E8B 742D                    	jz	short hu_20
 31851                                  
 31852 00002E8D 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the size of the largest
 31853 00002E8F E868FF                  	call	BigFree		; free element in AX; put its address in ES
 31854 00002E92 7226                    	jc	short hu_20	; Oops. Errors mean skip this part.
 31855                                  
 31856 00002E94 50                      	push	ax		; TOS==size of BigFree in UMB (popped as BX)
 31857 00002E95 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the user's specified
 31858 00002E97 E8B0FE                  	call	GetSize		; minimum size for this umb (into AX)
 31859 00002E9A 5B                      	pop	bx		; Now BX==BigFree, AX==Specified Size
 31860                                  
 31861 00002E9B 09C0                    	or	ax,ax		; If they didn't specify one,
 31862 00002E9D 741B                    	jz	short hu_20	; Skip over all this.
 31863                                  
 31864 00002E9F 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		; Ah... if (specified > max free)
 31865 00002EA1 7607                    	jbe	short hu_10
 31866                                  
 31867 00002EA3 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		;  Then mark that UMB as unused. Nya nya.
 31868 00002EA5 E814FD                  	call	unMarkUMB
 31869 00002EA8 EB10                    	jmp	short hu_20
 31870                                  hu_10:	
 31871                                  	;call	isTiny		; Returns ZF clear if user specified /S
 31872                                  	;jz	short hu_20
 31873                                  	; 02/01/2023
 31874                                  ;isTiny:
 31875                                  	;mov	al,[fUmbTiny] ; ds = cs
 31876                                  	;or	al,al
 31877 00002EAA 800E[781F]00            	or	byte [fUmbTiny],0
 31878 00002EAF 7409                    	jz	short hu_20
 31879                                  
 31880 00002EB1 E894FF                  	call	shrinkMCB	; They specified /S, so shrink the MCB to AX
 31881 00002EB4 7204                    	jc	short hu_20	; Ah... if didn't shrink after all, skip this:
 31882                                  
 31883 00002EB6 8CC2                    	mov	dx,es
 31884 00002EB8 EB09                    	jmp	short hu_30	; Skip the spec check.. we wanna hide this one.
 31885                                  
 31886 00002EBA 89C8                    hu_20:	mov	ax,cx
 31887 00002EBC E87DFF                  	call	isSpecified	; If they specified this UMB, we're done...
 31888 00002EBF 7510                    	jnz	short hu_X	; so leave.
 31889                                  
 31890 00002EC1 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 31891                                  hu_30:	
 31892 00002EC3 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 31893                                  
 31894 00002EC5 E89CFE                  	call	hideUMB		; Hides everything in UMB #al
 31895                                  
 31896 00002EC8 09D2                    	or	dx,dx		; Did we shrink a UMB? If not, DX==0,
 31897 00002ECA 7405                    	jz	short hu_X	; So we should leave.
 31898                                  
 31899 00002ECC 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx		; Ah, but if it isn't, DX==the MCB's address;
 31900 00002ECE E8E5FE                  	call	unHideMCB	; Un-hides the lower portion of that MCB.
 31901                                  hu_X:	
 31902 00002ED1 07                      	pop	es
 31903                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31904                                  	;pop	dx
 31905                                  	;pop	bx
 31906 00002ED2 C3                      	retn
 31907                                  
 31908                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31909                                  ;*** UnFreeze - Marks FROZEN elements as FREE

 31911                                  ; Entry:  None

 31913                                  ; Error:  None
 31914                                  ; Uses:   Flags

 32128                                  ;*** WalkMem - travels memory chain and returns carry clear iff UMBs are linked
 32129                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32130                                  ; ENTRY:    None

 32132                                  ; ERROR:    None

 32136                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 32139                                  WalkMem:
 32140                                  	;push	ax ; ?
 32141                                  	;push	bx ; ?
 32142                                  	;;push	ds ; ? ; 01/01/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:352Fh)

 32356 00002FDC 721A                    	jc	short fusX

 32401 0000300A 7519                    	jne	short ihm_x

 32404 0000300C 26813E0A004444          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME+2],'DD'
 32405 00003013 7510                    	jne	short ihm_x

 32430 00003034 26A30A00                	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+2],ax
 32431 00003038 26A30C00                	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+4],ax
 32432 0000303C 26A30E00                	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+6],ax

 32503                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32504                                  ; SYSCONF.ASM (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 32505                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32506                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32507                                  
 32508                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32509                                  ;
 32510                                  ; procedure : InitDevLoad
 32511                                  ;
 32512                                  ;	Input : DeviceHi = 0 indicates load DD in low memory
 32513                                  ;			 = 1 indicates load in UMB:
 32514                                  ;		           ConvLoad = 0 indicates a new-style load (see below)
 32515                                  ;		                    = 1 indicates a DOS 5-style load
 32516                                  ;		DevSize  = Size of the device driver file in paras
 32517                                  ;
 32518                                  ;	Output : none
 32519                                  ;
 32520                                  ;	Initializes DevLoadAddr, DevLoadEnd & DevEntry.
 32521                                  ;	Also sets up a header for the Device driver entry for mem utility
 32522                                  ;
 32523                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32524                                  ; For a "new-style load", we break off the current DevEntry and link the umbs
 32525                                  ; as we see fit, using HideUMBs (and UnHideUMBs at exit, though _it_ decides
 32526                                  ; whether it's entitled to do anything). HideUMBs uses the chart built by
 32527                                  ; ParseVar to determine which UMBs to leave FREE, and which not.
 32528                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32529                                  
 32530                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32531                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32532                                  	; (SYSINIT:364Ah)
 32533                                  InitDevLoad:
 32534                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32535                                  	;push	es ; *
 32536                                  
 32537                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32538                                  	; ds = cs
 32539 00003060 803E[CD1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 32540                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Are we loading in UMB ?
 32541                                  	;je	short InitForLo		; no, init for lo mem
 32542 00003065 7439                    	je	short initforlo_x ; 09/04/2019
 32543                                  
 32544                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32545                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32546                                  ; %if 0
 32547                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32548 00003067 803E[BD1F]01            	cmp	byte [ConvLoad],1	; Are we loading as per DOS 5?
 32549                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:ConvLoad],1	; Are we loading as per DOS 5?
 32550 0000306C 7413                    	je	short InitForConv
 32551                                  
 32552                                  ; There are two stages to preparing upper-memory; first, we mark as 8+HIDDEN
 32553                                  ; any areas not specified on the /L:... chain. Second, we mark as 8+FROZEN
 32554                                  ; any areas left in upper-memory, except for elements in the load UMB...
 32555                                  ; we then malloc space as per Dos-5 style, and mark as free any spaces which
 32556                                  ; are 8+FROZEN (but leave 8+HIDDEN still hidden). The load is performed,
 32557                                  ; and UnHideUMBs later on marks all 8+HIDDEN as free.
 32558                                  
 32559 0000306E E86904                  	call	ShrinkUMB		; Stop using the old device arena
 32560                                  
 32561 00003071 E899FC                  	call	HideUMBs		; Mark up the UM area as we see fit
 32562 00003074 E8CDFE                  	call	FreezeUM		; Hide everything BUT the load area
 32563 00003077 E85700                  	call	GetUMBForDev		; And grab that load area as needed
 32564 0000307A 9C                      	pushf
 32565 0000307B E855FE                  	call	UnFreeze		; Then unhide everything frozen
 32566 0000307E 9D                      	popf
 32567                                  	;jc	short InitForLo		; (if carry, it's loading low)
 32568                                  	;jmp	short InitForHi
 32569                                  	; 06/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 32570 0000307F EB0B                    	jmp	short idl0
 32571                                  
 32572                                  ;%endif ; 01/11/2022
 32573                                  
 32574                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32575                                  	; (SYSINIT:2B67h)
 32576                                  InitForConv:
 32577                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32578                                  	; ds = cs
 32579 00003081 E83700                  	call	SpaceInUMB		; Do we have space left in the
 32580                                  					;  current UMB ?
 32581 00003084 7308                    	jnc	short InitForHi		; yes, we have
 32582 00003086 E85104                  	call	ShrinkUMB		; shrink the current UMB in use
 32583 00003089 E84500                  	call	GetUMBForDev		; else try to allocate new UMB
 32584                                  idl0: ; 06/07/2023
 32585 0000308C 720D                    	jc	short InitForLo		; we didn't succeed, so load
 32586                                  					;  in low memory
 32587                                  InitForHi:
 32588                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32589                                  	; ds = cs
 32590                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevUMBFree]	; get Para addr of free mem
 32591                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:DevUMBAddr]	; UMB start addr
 32592                                  	;add	dx,[cs:DevUMBSize]	; DX = UMB End addr
 32593 0000308E A1[C31F]                	mov	ax,[DevUMBFree]
 32594 00003091 8B16[BF1F]              	mov	dx,[DevUMBAddr]
 32595 00003095 0316[C11F]              	add	dx,[DevUMBSize]
 32596 00003099 EB0C                    	jmp	short idl1
 32597                                  
 32598                                  InitForLo:
 32599                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32600                                  	; ds = cs
 32601                                  	;mov	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; in case we failed to load
 32602 0000309B C606[CD1F]00            	mov	byte [DeviceHi],0
 32603                                  initforlo_x:
 32604                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32605                                  	; ds = cs
 32606                                  					;  into UMB indicate that
 32607                                  					;  we are loading low
 32608                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:memhi]		; AX = start of Low memory
 32609                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; DX = End of Low memory
 32610 000030A0 A1[6403]                	mov	ax,[memhi]
 32611 000030A3 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]
 32612                                  idl1:
 32613 000030A7 E86C00                  	call	DevSetMark		; setup a sub-arena for DD
 32614                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32615                                  	; ds = cs
 32616                                  	;mov	[cs:DevLoadAddr],ax	; init the Device load address
 32617                                  	;mov	[cs:DevLoadEnd],dx	; init the limit of the block
 32618                                  	;mov	word [cs:DevEntry],0	; init Entry point to DD
 32619                                  	;mov	[cs:DevEntry+2],ax
 32620 000030AA A3[B11F]                	mov	[DevLoadAddr],ax
 32621 000030AD 8916[B31F]              	mov	[DevLoadEnd],dx
 32622 000030B1 C706[B51F]0000          	mov	word [DevEntry],0
 32623 000030B7 A3[B71F]                	mov	[DevEntry+2],ax
 32624                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32625                                  	;pop	es ; *
 32626 000030BA C3                      	retn
 32627                                  
 32628                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32629                                  ;
 32630                                  ; procedure : SpaceInUMB?
 32631                                  ;
 32632                                  ;	Input : DevUMBAddr, DevUMBSize, DevUMBFree & DevSize
 32633                                  ;	Output : Carry set if no space in UMB
 32634                                  ;		 Carry clear if Space is available for the device in
 32635                                  ;		   current UMB
 32636                                  ;
 32637                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32638                                  
 32639                                  SpaceInUMB:
 32640                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32641                                  	; ds = cs
 32642                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevUMBSize]
 32643                                  	;add	ax,[cs:DevUMBAddr]	; End of UMB

 32689                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32690                                  ;
 32691                                  ; procedure : GetUMBForDev
 32692                                  ;
 32693                                  ;	Input : DevSize
 32694                                  ;	Output : Carry set if couldn't allocate a UMB to fit the
 32695                                  ;		 the device.
 32696                                  ;		 If success carry clear
 32697                                  ;
 32698                                  ;	Allocates the biggest UMB for loading devices and updates
 32699                                  ;	DevUMBSize, DevUMBAddr & DevUMBFree if it succeeded in allocating
 32700                                  ;	UMB.
 32701                                  ;
 32702                                  ;	This routine relies on the fact that all of the low memory
 32703                                  ;	is allocated, and any DOS alloc calls should return memory
 32704                                  ;	from the UMB pool.
 32705                                  ;
 32706                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32707                                  
 32708                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32709                                  	; (SYSINIT:2BC6h)
 32710                                  
 32711                                  GetUMBForDev:
 32712                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32713                                  	; ds = cs
 32714 000030D1 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 32715 000030D4 B80048                  	mov	ax,4800h
 32716 000030D7 CD21                    	int	21h
 32717                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 32718                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 32719                                  
 32720 000030D9 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 32721 000030DB 742C                    	jz	short gufd_err
 32722                                  
 32723 000030DD 4B                      	dec	bx
 32724                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32725                                  	; ds = cs
 32726 000030DE 391E[AF1F]              	cmp	[DevSize],bx
 32727                                  	;cmp	[cs:DevSize],bx
 32728 000030E2 7725                    	ja	short gufd_err
 32729 000030E4 43                      	inc	bx
 32730                                  
 32731 000030E5 B80048                  	mov	ax,4800h
 32732 000030E8 CD21                    	int	21h
 32733 000030EA 721D                    	jc	short gufd_err
 32734                                  
 32735                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32736                                  	;dec	ax
 32737                                  	;call	PrepareMark
 32738                                  	;
 32739                                  PrepareMark:
 32740 000030EC 1E                      	push	ds
 32741 000030ED 48                      	dec	ax
 32742 000030EE 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 32743 000030F0 C70601000800            	mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],8
 32744 000030F6 C70608005344            	mov	word [ARENA.NAME],'SD' ; 4453h
 32745 000030FC 40                      	inc	ax
 32746 000030FD 1F                      	pop	ds
 32747                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32748                                  	; ds = cs
 32749                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBSize],bx	; update the UMB Variables
 32750                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBAddr],ax
 32751                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBFree],ax
 32752 000030FE 891E[C11F]              	mov	[DevUMBSize],bx		; update the UMB Variables
 32753 00003102 A3[BF1F]                	mov	[DevUMBAddr],ax
 32754 00003105 A3[C31F]                	mov	[DevUMBFree],ax
 32755                                  	;
 32756                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32757                                  	; cf=0
 32758                                  	;clc				; mark no error
 32759 00003108 C3                      	retn
 32760                                  gufd_err:
 32761 00003109 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 32762                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32763                                  	; ds = cs
 32764                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBSize],ax	; erase the previous values
 32765                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBAddr],ax
 32766                                  	;mov	[cs:DevUMBFree],ax

 32768 0000310E A3[BF1F]                	mov	[DevUMBAddr],ax

 32770 00003114 F9                      	stc
 32771 00003115 C3                      	retn

 32774                                  ;
 32775                                  ; procedure : DevSetMark
 32776                                  ;
 32777                                  ;	Input : AX - Free segment were device is going to be loaded
 32778                                  ;	Output : AX - Segment at which device can be loaded (AX=AX+1)
 32779                                  ;
 32780                                  ;	Creates a sub-arena for the device driver
 32781                                  ;	puts 'D' marker in the sub-arena
 32782                                  ;	Put the owner of the sub-arena as (AX+1)
 32783                                  ;	Copies the file name into sub-arena name field
 32784                                  ;
 32785                                  ;	Size field of the sub-arena will be set only at succesful
 32786                                  ;	completion of Device load.
 32787                                  ;
 32788                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32789                                  
 32790                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32791                                  	; (SYSINIT:2C13h)
 32792                                  
 32793                                  DevSetMark:
 32794 00003116 06                      	push	es
 32795                                  	; 03/01/2023
 32796                                  	;push	di
 32797 00003117 1E                      	push	ds
 32798 00003118 56                      	push	si
 32799 00003119 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 32800 0000311B 26C606000044            	mov	byte [es:devmark.id],devmark_device ; 'D'
 32801 00003121 40                      	inc	ax
 32802 00003122 26A30100                	mov	[es:devmark.seg],ax
 32803                                  
 32804                                  ;-------------- Copy file name
 32805                                  
 32806 00003126 50                      	push	ax			; save load addr
 32807 00003127 2EC536[7C03]            	lds	si,[cs:bpb_addr]	; command line is still there
 32808                                  
 32809 0000312C 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 32810 0000312E FC                      	cld
 32811                                  dsm_again:
 32812 0000312F AC                      	lodsb
 32813 00003130 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'
 32814 00003132 7504                    	jne	short isit_slash
 32815 00003134 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 32816 00003136 EBF7                    	jmp	short dsm_again
 32817                                  isit_slash:
 32818 00003138 3C5C                    	cmp	al, '\'
 32819 0000313A 7504                    	jne	short isit_null
 32820 0000313C 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 32821 0000313E EBEF                    	jmp	short dsm_again
 32822                                  isit_null:
 32823 00003140 08C0                    	or	al,al
 32824 00003142 75EB                    	jnz	short dsm_again
 32825 00003144 89FE                    	mov	si,di
 32826                                  
 32827 00003146 BF0800                  	mov	di,devmark.filename ; 8
 32828 00003149 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; maximum 8 characters
 32829                                  dsm_next_char:
 32830 0000314C AC                      	lodsb
 32831 0000314D 08C0                    	or	al, al
 32832 0000314F 7407                    	jz	short blankout
 32833 00003151 3C2E                    	cmp	al, '.'
 32834 00003153 7403                    	je	short blankout
 32835 00003155 AA                      	stosb
 32836 00003156 E2F4                    	loop	dsm_next_char
 32837                                  blankout:
 32838 00003158 E304                    	jcxz	dsm_exit
 32839 0000315A B020                    	mov	al, ' '
 32840 0000315C F3AA                    	rep	stosb			; blank out the rest
 32841                                  dsm_exit:
 32842 0000315E 58                      	pop	ax			; restore load addr
 32843 0000315F 5E                      	pop	si
 32844 00003160 1F                      	pop	ds
 32845                                  	; 03/01/2023
 32846                                  	;pop	di
 32847 00003161 07                      	pop	es
 32848 00003162 C3                      	retn

 32852                                  ; procedure : SizeDevice
 32853                                  ;
 32854                                  ;	Input : ES:SI - points to device file to be sized
 32855                                  ;
 32856                                  ;	Output : Carry set if file cannot be opened or if it is an OS2EXE file
 32857                                  ;
 32858                                  ;	Calculates the size of the device file in paras and stores it
 32859                                  ;	in DevSize

 32861                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32871 00003168 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h		; open

 32879 00003178 CD21                    	int	21h

 32881 0000317C 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; para convert
 32882 0000317F 83D200                  	adc	dx,0
 32883 00003182 F7C2F0FF                	test	dx,0FFF0h		; size > 0ffffh paras ?
 32884                                  	;jz	short szdev1		; no
 32885                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32886 00003186 7409                    	jz	short sd_ctp
 32887 00003188 2EC706[AF1F]FFFF        	mov	word [cs:DevSize],0FFFFh ; invalid device size
 32888                                  					; assuming that we fail later
 32889 0000318F EB0E                    	jmp	short sd_close
 32890                                  sd_ctp:	
 32891                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32892                                  ;szdev1:
 32893 00003191 B104                    	mov	cl,4			; convert it to paras
 32894 00003193 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl
 32895 00003195 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 32896 00003197 D3E2                    	shl	dx,cl
 32897 00003199 09D0                    	or	ax,dx ; * ; cf=0
 32898                                  	;
 32899                                  	; 22/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 32900                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 IO:SYS - SYSINIT:37A6h 
 32901                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32902                                  	;cmp	ax,[cs:DevSizeOption]
 32903                                  	;ja	short szdev2
 32904                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevSizeOption]
 32905                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32906                                  	;clc
 32907                                  ;szdev2:
 32908 0000319B 2EA3[AF1F]              	mov	[cs:DevSize],ax		; save file size (in paragraps)
 32909                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32910                                  	;clc ; cf=0 ; *	; CLC is not needed here
 32911                                  			; (OR instruction clears CF) - E.TAN 22/07/2023
 32912                                  
 32913                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32914                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32915                                  	; cf=0
 32916                                  	;clc
 32917                                  sd_close:
 32918 0000319F 9C                      	pushf				; let close not spoil our
 32919                                  					;  carry flag
 32920 000031A0 B8003E                  	mov	ax,3E00h		; close
 32921 000031A3 CD21                    	int	21h			; we are not checking for err
 32922 000031A5 9D                      	popf

 32934                                  ;		DevLoadAddr - contains where device has to be loaded
